Shiba Inu (SHIB) has gapped downâ€¦ [+15430 chars]
content_full: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. Shiba Inuâ€™s (SHIB) price rose by 3% amid the expectation that the beta launch of Shiba Inuâ€™s layer-two network, Shibarium, could happen by the end of the week. This has helped cap a 10% rise for SHIB in the last 30 days.  Read Price Prediction for Shiba Inu [SHIB] for 2023-24  The arrival of Shibarium potentially marked a new era for Shiba Inu, in which it moves from being just a meme cryptocurrency to being a platform that offered genuine utility.      Shiba Inu, a coin that has since grown in popularity, was founded in 2020 by an anonymous techpreneur. Elon Musk and Vitalik Buterin, both tech billionaires, have praised the project. Shiba Inu has been successful in attracting people who missed the Dogecoin craze previously. Investors seeking to join the joke have increased the popularity of memecoins, which are not supposed to be taken seriously. Shiba Inu has been known to be a disrupter when it comes to management and operations. The enterprise began with a supply of one quadrillion; its founder Ryoshi first locked 50% in Uniswap and then burned another 50% to Vitalik Buterin, the founder of Ethereum. We are yet to know why this step was taken. Later in 2021, Buterin burned 90% of his Shiba Inu holdings and donate the rest to charities. He had earlier donated SHIB tokens worth $1 billion to a COVID-19 relief fund for India, CryptoRelief. He said that this was the only way he could avoid his transactions in Shiba Inu being read as actions. Buterinâ€™s decision to burn his holdings, nearly 50% of the Shiba Inu coins in circulation, effectively put them outside the purview of the market since these coins are now stored on an inaccessible public address. Ryoshi thanked Buterin for his contribution to creating a decentralized financial system. Buterin has also praised the Shiba Inu community for supporting different initiatives such as the Fellows in AI Existential Safety. Soon, the memecoin will migrate to layer-2 following the Shibarium update. The platform also supports the Shiba Inu Incubator, facilitating a large group of creative digital artists who bring forth an experience of what feels like a decentralized movement. The NFT project gives support to artists in the creation, exhibition, promotion and auction of their artworks, besides providing them with other streams of income. In early August this year, the Shiba Inu Ecosystem announced on Twitter the name of the Shib CCG game, Shiba Eternity. It also revealed that the game would be available on both Google PlayStore and Apple AppStore. On 17 September, the game was launched in Australia and plans to venture into other countries.Â  The community is also involved in rescuing real Shiba Inu dogs through its association with the NGO named Shiba Inu Rescue Association. Skeptics are unsure of the future of cryptocurrency and memecoins in particular. While the mainstream cryptocurrencies projected themselves to be the alternatives to fiat currencies, memestream cryptocurrencies such as Shiba Inu were only poking fun at the formerâ€™s claims.Â  But as these memecoins got popular, they didnâ€™t go in the direction of developing use cases of the currency. That wasnâ€™t the intention either, neither did the community expect such a popularity in the growth of memecoins. There are, however, a number of merchants today in the US accepting Shiba Inu as a payment method. Another factor affecting the growth of the Shiba Inu currency is the huge number of crypto whales selling the memecoins. As per a report, whales at one point of time held $1 billion worth of SHIB coins. However, they keep selling and burning the currency from time to time, and now they hold barely a fraction of that amount.Â  The burgeoning cryptocurrency market proved to be pleasant for SHIB as well. The Shiba Inu communityâ€™s demand to get the coin listed on Robinhood Markets Inc. hitting an ATH of $0.00008845 in late-October 2021.Â  The second quarter of 2022 proved to be a bloodbath, however, with SHIB suffering. At press time, it was valued at $0.00001191.Â  Why these projections matterÂ  As is evident, a sense of community is crucial to the growth of SHIB. Whether it is their demand to get it listed on Robinhood or asking McDonaldâ€™s to accept it as a mode of payment, the community has always rallied around the growth of SHIB.   Iâ€™m getting a Shiba Inu #resistanceisfutile â€” Elon Musk (@elonmusk) March 14, 2021  It has also become a home to a huge community of NFT artists who focus on the Shiba Inu breed of dogs in their artworks.Â  â€œRather than simply dismissing the hype outright, itâ€™s important to realize that what weâ€™re seeing is the mass movement of traders new to crypto moving into the space,â€ said Ben Caselin, Head of Research and Strategy at AAX. He added, â€œSHIB coin is a meme coin and embraces that.â€ As it runs on an Ethereum platform, it currently employs the proof-of-work (PoW) consensus mechanism and will transition to the proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanism. The upcoming Ethereum 2.0 transition will also certainly impact the growth of the currency.Â  In this article, we will give an overview of the key performance indicators of SHIB such as price and market cap. We will then share with you what most popular crypto-analysts have to say about the future of this meme coin. This information will be complemented by data charts for a better understanding of the trajectory of SHIB so far and later.Â  Shiba Inuâ€™s Price, Market Cap and everything in between During the crypto-bloom of 2021, SHIBâ€™s price continued to soar and hit 0.00003503 in mid-May. Its price further rose by over 34% when it got listed on the crypto-exchange Coinbase in September 2021.Â  When the Shiba Inu community clamoured to get the cryptocurrency listed on Robinhood Markets Inc., its price soared to an ATH of $0.00008845 in late October 2021. The altcoin, however, was not listed on the exchange before April 2022. At that point in time, it even dislodged Dogecoin to become the most-valued meme coin by market capitalization. The surge also led to its mass adoption by many cryptocurrency enthusiasts.Â  As the cryptocurrency market crashed during Q2 of 2022, SHIBâ€™s market price also continued to fall. From its April 2022 price of 0.000026, it fell to a little below $0.000008 by mid-June 2022. Since then, it hasnâ€™t performed any better, sitting at $0.00001256 at press time, with a market cap of $6,908,753,147.Â  Source: TradingView However, one cannot disregard the fact that along with DOGE, SHIB has been responsible for a flood of meme-coins in the cryptocurrency market such as Bit Shiba, King Shiba and Baby Doge.Â  Shiba Inu Coinâ€™s 2025 PredictionsÂ  Before reading further, we must understand that market predictions of different analysts widely vary. A good number of times, these predictions will prove to be wrong as analysts cannot always foresee events such as political or environmental crises. It is wise that an investor conducts their own research before investing in a cryptocurrency, especially in something as volatile as SHIB.Â  For instance, a Changelly blogpost claimed that after studying SHIB prices and market fluctuations, experts predict that SHIB could go as high as $0.00005048 and as low as $0.00004183. Its potential ROI for the said year is predicted to be 322%, with its average price remaining $0.00004335.Â  Telegaon concurred, finding that according to some crypto-experts, Shiba Inu Coinâ€™s price can hit a new ATH in 2025. On the contrary, even though they expect enough tokens being burnt this year, they are not so hopeful about its price rise in 2022. They predict the maximum and minimum prices of SHIB to be $0.0001928 and $0.00009839, respectively. Its average price was predicted to be around $0.0001152.Â  Shiba Inu Coinâ€™s 2030 PredictionsÂ  The aforementioned Changelly blogpost also mentioned that in 2030, SHIB will be traded at an average price of $0.00030921. Its maximum and minimum prices will be $0.00035649 and $0.00029857, respectively. The potential ROI for SHIB in 2030 is predicted to be 2,878%.Â  Now, thereâ€™s good reason to believe why SHIBâ€™s price might hike on the charts. For instance, according to many, if users burn enough tokens, a cryptocurrencyâ€™s acceptance is bound to increase. That being said, the meme coin must cultivate a host of different use cases too.Â  And, not everyone agrees with whatever utility meme-coins like DOGE and SHIB might have either. Ripple CEO Brad Garlinghouse, for instance, believes that this asset class isnâ€™t good for the market at large. In fact, it has often been speculated that these assets are part of a bubble.  Are your SHIB holdings flashing green? Check the profit calculator  Back in April, Finder surveyed a panel of 26 experts who predicted a rather gloomy picture for the future of Shiba Inu coin. They predicted that the average price of SHIB in 2030 will be as low as $0.000000325.Â  Speaking for a majority of the panelists, Dimitrios Salampasis claimed,  â€œI am of the opinion that all these joke-type coins will disappear and leave space for actual innovation and crypto-assets that can serve proper use cases.â€Â  Source: Finder Fear & Greed Index  Â  Source: CFGI.io At the time of writing, SHIBâ€™s Fear and Greed Index was at the â€˜neutralâ€™ position. ConclusionÂ  Shiba Inu Coin has continued to grow, hand in hand with the token burns. However, as its supply decreases and demand increases, its price should rise. Ideally. In fact, many investors have become millionaires by investing in this meme coin.Â  Shiba Inu has a lot of promising possibilities that will keep pushing the market. What also works in its favor is its extremely low price, which is why a lot of people keep buying it.Â  This July, Shiba Inu developer Shytoshi Kusama informed the users about further developments in aÂ blogpost. Progress on Shibarium, the platformâ€™s Layer 2 protocol, is on track. The update will allow users to move assets with minor gas fees, facilitating micro transactions over Shiba Inu-based dApps. The team has deployed a host of new and innovative developers to build the UX/UI of its platform and web portals as a part of the same process. The post also informed that the developers are yet to determine the launch date of its beta version. SHI, a stablecoin, is also expected to be released this year. Kusama acknowledges that its development is a cause of concern now that other stablecoins have collapsed, creating losses worth millions of dollars. The team of developers, the post adds, is working to build such a coin that will avoid the problems associated with other moonshots. This will allow SHI to be used for transactions that need to be done without market fluctuations. An experimental protocol, more details in its regard will be shared once it is finalized. A new token, TREAT, is also upcoming that will be used as a reward token on Shiba Inu-based metaverse and games such as the Shiba Collectible Card Game. A limited supply of these coins is reserved for its most loyal Breed members who have been working for years to build public confidence in the entity. The post also announced that its metaverse and card game will also be launched in time.Â  In January this year, Shiba Inu Ecosystem announced the arrival of Shiberse, the native metaverse of the Shiba Inu community. As digital coins, games, virtual land and memes populate the Shiberse, it is bound to get popular among an audience that is keen to explore a brave new world beyond the confines of time and space.Â  Only recently, the group tweeted the news about Shiba Eternity, a collectible card game. The game is being developed in close collaboration with the legendary AAA game development studio PlaySide Studios.Â  What the enterprise is certain to face is a challenge in this space from Big Tech metaverse ventures such as Yuga Labsâ€™ Otherside and Zuckerbergâ€™s Meta. It is difficult for an independent community such as the Shiba Inu Ecosystem to sustain the might of Big Money and Big Tech. The only way it can gain an edge in this segment is by introducing revolutionary ideas in the metaverse, gaming and NFT segments. So far, we havenâ€™t seen anything new.Â  How the upcoming Ethereum Merge affects the growth of Shiba Inu coins is also to be observed. Among the most anticipated changes are the reduced gas fees and more transactions per second.Â  These are all crucial developments for the SHIB space. And, some would believe that the cryptoâ€™s price would be accordingly affected too. In fact, Finderâ€™s panel concluded that, â€œHype is going to continue as the driving force behind the value of SHIB, with 82% of the panel saying memecoin hype will have a significant impact on Shiba Inuâ€™s price this year. A touch over two-fifths (41%) see its inclusion on major broker platforms like Robinhood helping it to gain steam, with 12% citing the launch of ShibaSwap.â€ Source: Finder The trajectory of Shiba Inu is similar to that of other cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin is a significant factor that affects the price movement of Shiba Inu. Shiba Inu follows Bitcoinâ€™s price like all other cryptocurrencies. Shiba Inuâ€™s price increases in value when that of Bitcoin does. As we can see, there is a lot of anticipation associated with the innovations brought forward by Shiba Inu Coin. Even so, there is a lot of uncertainty regarding its future. Investors should therefore conduct their own research before investing in the currency.Â  The recent takeover of Twitter by Elon Musk could prove to be a boon for Shiba Inu and other memecoins. Given Muskâ€™s interest, it is highly likely that the social media platform is going to be more crypto-centric. Early this month, Google Cloud and Coinbase made an announcement about their relationship for Web 3.0 development initiatives. A select group of clients will also be able to pay for these services using SHIB and other cryptocurrencies. Weâ€™ll have to wait and see if the decision is implemented and if other businesses decide to follow suit. Shiba Inuâ€™s journey is similar to that of other cryptocurrencies. Bitcoin is a significant factor influencing Shiba Inu price movement. Shiba Inu, like all other cryptocurrencies, tracks the price of Bitcoin. Last week, Shiba Inu lead developer Shytoshi Kusama recently took to Twitter to ask whether the community desired the memecoin to collaborate with the World Economic Forum (WEF) on Metaverse global policy.  Crypto Twitter expressed doubts that the collaboration would cause the Shibarium, a layer-two blockchain that will play a key role in burning the supply of Shiba Inu tokens, to be delayed.Â  Meanwhile, as per a recent partnership between Binance with the Bahraini payment provider EazyPay, customers of the telecommunication company, stc Bahrain, can now pay their bills through the SHIB coins. Shytoshi Kusama, the anonymous SHIB lead developer, hinted around Christmas thatÂ  there could be a new partnership in the works relating to the Shibarium project. Shibarium is an upcoming Ethereum Layer 2 scaling solution that will host the ecosystemâ€™s metaverse platform, games and a decentralized exchange. This could lead to bullish market sentiment for the coin.Â  Analysts speculate that SHIB cryptocurrency might retrace its recovery path as soon as it gets support from the level. However, volume change can be seen declining and under the influence of sellers. Buyers need to come forward to rescue the SHIB token from the sellerâ€™s grip. The imminent launch of Shibarium will eventually be magnified by SHIB: The Metaverse, a Shiba Inu-themed virtual world in which users can explore and own NFT-based plots of land (and various other items). Itâ€™s due to launch later in the year, and perhaps even more than Shibarium, it will help Shiba Inu become more of a full-fledged platform, rather than just a meme token.        Share                                     Share     Tweet

title: Stellar (XLM) Price Prediction 2025-30: Is there a â€˜Stellarâ€™ run on the horizon?
description: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. Stellar Lumens (XLM) was trading near its midpoint for the past five days. At press time, hoâ€¦
content:
Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
Stellar Lumens (XLM) was tradingâ€¦ [+18489 chars]
content_full: Â Stellar (XLM): An overviewSource: Stellar.orgÂ Stellar is an open-source, peer-to-peer blockchain network that allows easy exchange and conversion of digital currency with any fiat currency and vice versa. The network aims to integrate distributed ledger technology (DLT)Â into traditional banking systems. Using blockchain technology, it facilitates easy, fast, and affordable cross-border transactions between any currency pair.The network has its own native cryptocurrencyâ€”Stellar Lumens (XLM), which plays an essential role in facilitating transactions. It serves three main purposes:XLM is used as aÂ bridge currency for cross-border transactions, which makes the network capable of exchanging and processing different currency transactions.It is used to pay transaction fees on the network.The coin can be used forÂ staking, and users can earn incentives for validating transactions on the blockchain.At present, the circulating supply of XLM isÂ 27.7 billion. The coin is deflationary, with a maximum supply ofÂ 50 billion. However, the coins cannot be mined, and each time a transaction is made,Â 100 stroops (0.00001 XLM) are burned. In order to use the network, users are required to hold a certain amount ofÂ Stellar Lumens. This requirement helps protect the network against spam and avoids accounts with zero balance.UnlikeÂ BitcoinÂ (BTC), which is used as a means to transfer value directly, Stellar was created to perform as an intermediary for easy currency conversions. It does not seek to replace traditional financial institutions but rather to enhance them by providing a single network for everyone to collaborate and work together.Â How does Stellar function?Source: Stellar.orgÂ The Stellar network is comprised of three basic elements:Â Horizon API: This works like a web service that allows applications, online banking apps, payment services, and mobile wallets to interact with the Stellar network. The API also supports the creation ofÂ Stellar Smart ContractsÂ (SSCs).Â Stellar core: is connected to every Horizon server and maintains a copy of the digital ledger. It is responsible for handling the validation of transactions through theÂ Stellar Consensus Protocol (SCP), which facilitates reaching a consensus on the state of the network.Â Â The Stellar core secures the public history of transactions by entering ledgers into permanent external storage and guarantees the non-duplication of blocks within the network.Â Stellar network: This is the decentralized worldwide network of nodes that run the Stellar core. Each node is run by either an individual or an organization. The network is distributed, which safeguards it from spam and ensures its proper functioning.Â To validate transactions, the blockchain uses a uniqueÂ SCP, which is based on theÂ Federated Byzantine Agreement (FBA) algorithm. This allows nodes to interact efficiently with each other to reach a consensus.Â In order to reduce the transaction time and make the network more scalable, the network employs two important features:Â Quorum slices: To validate a transaction, a node in the network interacts with other trusted nodes to form a web of trust or aÂ mini network known as a quorum slice. The node or validator collects votes from their slice to determine the validity of a transaction.Â If the transaction receives approval from every node in the slice, then it is deemed valid. Stellar's network is reported to process up toÂ 1,000 network operations per secondÂ as a result ofÂ the accelerated procedure.Â Anchors: These are trusted entities within the network that enable the exchange of currencies on the Stellar blockchain. They are responsible for holding deposits and disseminating credit.Â These features accelerate the transaction processing time and allow users to complete cross-border transactions in a fast, cheap, and secure manner.Â Stellar's journeySource: Stellar.orgÂ The Stellar project was launched inÂ 2014 byÂ Jed McCaleb, co-founder of Ripple and founder of crypto exchangeÂ Mt. Gox, in collaboration withÂ Joyce Kim. At its launch, the network receivedÂ $3 million in seed funding from a payment company,Â Stripe, in exchange forÂ 2% (2 billion XLM) of the initial launch.Â It was launched initially as a hard fork of theÂ Ripple (XRP) code but has since evolved into its own blockchain network. While the main customer base for Ripple comprises financial institutions, Stellar's focus lies in developing markets and being the currency for individuals.Â Along with the network, theÂ Stellar Development FoundationÂ (SDF)Â was also launched. It's a non-profit organization that supports the technical and commercial communities for the network, looks after the code, and publishes regular updates on the Stellar network.Â When the network launched in 2014,Â 100 billion XLM were created.Â 5% of the supply was set aside to fund operations like spending or employee compensation, etc. The remainingÂ 95% was set to be dispersed among various entities:50% was set to be distributed to people who signed up for an account.25% was allocated to non-profit organizations focused on financial inclusion.20% was to be distributed among Bitcoin and Ripple holders.The foundation also sought to raise the supply byÂ 1% annually over the following five years. However, inÂ 2019, the Stellar community voted to end this yearly supply increase. The current supply was also halved by 50%, which led to the maximum supply being capped atÂ 50 billion.Â Following aÂ ledger fork in 2014 that wiped back hours of transactions, Stellar revised its consensus protocol inÂ April 2015 and adopted the SCP. SCP was developed byÂ David MaziÃ¨res, chief scientist of the SDF.Â Major developmentsÂ Source: Stellar.orgÂ Some of the major developments/milestones of Stellar are as follows:March 2015: SDF held aÂ public auction for Stellars viaÂ Poloniex andÂ Kraken.Nov 2015: Stellar upgraded its network, which introduced safety properties that secured the network against forking and reduced the codebase size.Apr 2016:Â 3 billionÂ Lumens were distributed amongÂ Bitcoin holdersMay 2017: The network introducedÂ Lightyear.io, which focused on the creation of products and services on top of the Stellar network.June 2017: AnotherÂ 16 billion Lumens were airdropped toÂ Bitcoin holdersÂ November 2018: SDF distributed up toÂ 500 millionÂ XLM among users of the leading digital asset wallet provider,Â Blockchain.Â June 2019: The network upgraded toÂ Protocol 11,Â which introduced improvements in transaction fees and network capacity.September 2019: Stellar partnered withÂ Keybase for a major airdrop, giving away up toÂ 2 billionÂ XLM over the next 20 months to Keybase users.December 2021:Â Starlight, aÂ Layer 2 protocol, was launched.February 2021: Stellar launched the stablecoinÂ USDC on its blockchain. The coin is pegged to the US Dollar at a 1:1 ratio and is backed byÂ Circleâ€”a fintech firm.March 2023: The Stellar blockchain launched its newÂ Spacewalk bridge, which linked it toÂ Polkadot (DOT). The bridge went live onÂ Kusama,Â Polkadot's test network. Moreover, the primary currency flowing through the bridge will be the USDC stablecoin.Â June 2023:Â CoinbaseÂ integrated withÂ USDC on the Stellar network.August 2023:Â Sorobanâ€™s core functionalities were completed.September 2023: NewÂ Stellar Asset SandboxÂ was unveiled.Â 2023 roadmapSource: Stellar.orgÂ The 2023 roadmap for Stellar was focused on taking the network utility to the next level using three building blocks:Â Make innovation easy and scalableSDF focused on the following strategic initiatives to make innovation easy and scalable:Soroban development: This involved the launch of a new developer-friendly, scalable, and Stellar-integrated smart contract platform.Scaling and decentralization:Â To ensure that the network can handle increased traffic.Wallet tools:Â To make it easy for developers to build Stellar wallets.Â Â Win over buildersThe following strategic initiatives were implemented to fulfill this:Tier 1 assets: This focused on accelerating the growth of the most used assets in the world to be represented on Stellar.Access:Â To promote the development of accessible, easy-to-use, and cost-competitive apps.Soroban adoption: To increase the contribution to the DeFi ecosystem with real, sustainable use cases leveraging smart contracts.Â Focus on utility to build trustÂ SDF sought to foster trust through utility and framed the following strategic initiatives:Public policy: To create a credible and reliable image among the public and private sectors.Public profile:Â To raise platform awareness so that more companies and developers are building on Stellar.Products: To maintain and ensure the highest quality standard of Stellar flagship wallet products for new entrants and power users.

author: Ishika Kumari
title: LBank offers support to Turkey earthquake victims with emergency relief aid
description: Today, LBank, a leading global cryptocurrency exchange, has stepped up to help Turkeyâ€™s earthquake victims by providing emergency relief aid to the affected areas.Â  The exchange cooperated with two different non-governmental organizations to send a truck carrâ€¦
content:
Today, LBank, a leading global cryptocurrency exchange, has stepped up to help Turkeys earthquake victims by providing emergency relief aid to the affected areas.Â 
The exchange cooperated with two dâ€¦ [+2062 chars]
content_full: Today, LBank, a leading global cryptocurrency exchange, has stepped up to help Turkeyâ€™s earthquake victims by providing emergency relief aid to the affected areas.Â  The exchange cooperated with two different non-governmental organizations to send a truck carrying essential supplies such as food, water, medical supplies, and clothing to those who have been affected by the earthquake. LBankâ€™s CEO, Allen Wei, expressed his deep concern and sadness over the situation, stating: â€œOur thoughts are with the people of Turkey during this difficult time. We hope that our small contribution will help ease their pain and provide some comfort in their time of need.â€ â€œLBank is proud to have played a small role in this humanitarian effort, and we encourage others to lend their support in any way possible,â€ Wei added. As of February 8th, 2023, the death toll of the earthquake surpassed 12,000, making it one of the deadliest natural disasters in recent history. The situation is still dire, with many individuals remaining trapped beneath the rubble and rescue efforts being hampered by supply and logistical challenges. The earthquake, thought to have originated from the East Anatolian fault system, had its epicenter near Gaziantep in southern Turkey and was recorded as a 7.8-magnitude quake.  This was followed by a series of powerful aftershocks, with the largest registering a 7.5 magnitude and occurring 60 miles from the original epicenter. Some seismologists even consider this as a separate earthquake. While rescue efforts continue, LBank announced that it will continue to support those affected by providing necessary relief materials and medical supplies. The trading platform says it is working closely with local authorities and relief organizations to ensure that these resources reach the hardest hit areas and provide much-needed aid to those who have lost everything. LBank also noted its gratitude to the two non-governmental organizations for their support in coordinating and delivering aid to those who need it most. This donation is just one of many initiatives that LBank is involved in, aimed at making a positive impact in the lives of people and communities. Disclaimer: This is a paid post and should not be treated as news/advice.  Share                                     Share     Tweet

title: Solana (SOL) Price Prediction 2025-30: SOL struggles to stay above $20
description: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. Solana (SOL) traded within a range (orange) between $20.4 and $26.6, with the midpoint at $2â€¦
content:
Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
Solana (SOL) traded within a ranâ€¦ [+13481 chars]
content_full: Â Solana (SOL): An overviewSource: Solana.comÂ At its core,Â Solana (SOL)Â is a blockchain built for mass adoption. The platform prides itself in claiming to be fast, composable, green, and globally distributed.Â Its blockchain architecture is designed to accommodate smart contracts andÂ decentralized applications (dApps) creation. The platform serves the needs of an array ofÂ decentralized finance (DeFi)Â platforms andÂ non-fungible token (NFT)Â marketplaces.Â Solana offers a robust platform with impressive metrics. Here's an overview of its statistics:Active accounts:Â Solana boasts overÂ 11.5 million active accounts.NFTs minted: The platform has seen the minting ofÂ 21.9 million NFTs.Transaction speed: Solana ensures a seamless user experience with block times of justÂ 400 milliseconds. As technology advances, the network speed will further accelerate.Decentralization: Solana's security is rooted in its decentralization, with thousands of nodes operating autonomously. This ensures data integrity and resistance to censorship. Currently, the network is fortified by aroundÂ 1,964Â validator nodes.Scalability: Designed for growth, Solana can handle aroundÂ 4,000Â transactions per second in practice. Remarkably, fees for both developers and users typically stay belowÂ $0.0025.Â Environmental impact: Each transaction on Solana consumes energy equivalent to just a few Google searches, resulting in a net carbon impact ofÂ 0%.Â SOLSource: Solana.comÂ SOL, the intrinsic cryptocurrency of the Solana blockchain, plays multiple vital roles within its ecosystem. Here's an overview of its functionalities and significance:Staking:Â SOL tokens can beÂ staked by validators and delegators to engage in the blockchain's consensus process. This act of staking fortifies the network's security, and as a token of appreciation, those who stake are rewarded for their contributions.Transaction fees:Â Transactions executed on the Solana network incur fees, which are settled using SOL. Solana's optimized efficiency ensures these transaction costs remain competitively low.Rent mechanism: Solana has implemented aÂ rentÂ system for data storage. Accounts must uphold a certain minimumÂ SOL balance; failing to do so might lead to their data being temporarily removed from storage. However, these accounts can be revived later. This model ensures efficient use of storage space, reserving it primarily for active accounts.Upon its launch, SOL debuted with an initial supply ofÂ 500 million tokens. Interestingly, there isn't a set cap on SOL's maximum supply. The token's inflation dynamics started at anÂ 8% rate.Â Â This inflation rate is set to undergo aÂ 15% reduction each year, and over time, it will stabilize, settling at a consistent long-term inflation rate ofÂ 1.5%.Â Â Additionally, the protocol has been designed such that half of each transaction fee getsÂ burned. Consequently, as the transaction volume surges, it will naturally slow the expansion of the circulating supply. As of October 2023, the total supply of SOL isÂ 558,983,589, and the circulating supply isÂ 413,438,407.Â How does Solana work?Source: Solana/TwitterÂ The network combinesÂ Proof-of-Stake (PoS) withÂ Proof-of-History (PoH), creating a unique hybrid consensus mechanism. Its innovative approach to technology has gained significant traction in the market.Â Â Here's a deeper dive into how Solana works, focusing on its groundbreaking innovations:Â PoH: Unlike other blockchains that rely on traditionalÂ timestamps, Solana's PoH is a cryptographic way to verify the passage of time between events. This eliminates the need for every node to communicate with each other to determine the sequence of events.Â Parallelization:Â This refers to Solana's capability to processÂ multiple transactions simultaneously. Instead of transactions being processed one after the other, they can be executed concurrently, leading to increased throughput and efficiency.Â Tower Byzantine Fault Tolerance (BFT): While the concept of BFT is not new, Solana's version is optimized using PoH. This ensures that the consensus achieved is both secure and fast.Â Turbine: This is Solana's solution for the efficient broadcasting of information (like blocks) to the network. Instead of sending the entire data to all nodes, it breaks the data into smaller packets, making it easier and faster for nodes to receive and process them.Â Gulf Stream:Â Traditional blockchains have aÂ mempool where pending transactions wait. Gulf Stream, however, allows validators to execute transactions ahead of time, removing the need for a mempool and speeding up transaction confirmations.Â Sealevel:Â On many blockchains,Â smart contracts are processed one at a time. Sealevel, however, allows for parallel processing of smart contracts, ensuring multiple contracts can run simultaneously without bottlenecking the system.Â Pipelining:Â Think of this as an assembly line for transaction processing. Solana's pipelining technique assigns specific duties to hardware, likeÂ signature verification, to optimize the transaction validation process.Â Cloudbreak: Databases often become a bottleneck in decentralized systems. Cloudbreak is Solana's way toÂ horizontally scale its accounts database, ensuring that as the database grows, its performance doesn't degrade.Â Archivers: In Solana, not all nodes store the complete history due to the sheer volume of data. Instead, specific nodes called archivers take on the role of data storage, ensuring that the historical record is maintained without burdening every node in the system.Â History of SolanaSource: Solana.comÂ In late 2017, Anatoly Yakovenko introduced the foundational concept for Solana by releasing a draftÂ white paper. This whitepaper detailed a unique timekeeping method for distributed systems, termed PoH.Â Yakovenko teamed up with Greg Fitzgerald, a former colleague from Qualcomm. Their collaboration led to the creation of a PoH blockchain testnet.Â By February 2018, they had released the project's official paper alongside the internal testnet. 2018 also marked the formation ofÂ Solana Labs, which began its fundraising activities during the same year.Â The team successfully raised overÂ $20 million in a private Series A funding round that extended into 2019. Solana'sÂ mainnet was officially launched in March 2020.Â Subsequent to this launch, Solana secured an additionalÂ $1.76 million through a public token sale. This sale was facilitated by the cryptocurrency auction platformâ€”CoinList.Â WhileÂ Solana LabsÂ remains the primary contributor to the network, there is also theÂ Solana Foundation. This non-profit organization, based in Zug, Switzerland, provides financial support for ongoing development. Moreover, it plays a pivotal role in fostering community-building activities for the blockchain.

title: Analyst Predicts Major Pain for Investors Expecting Bitcoin (BTC) To Crash to $10,000 â€“ Hereâ€™s His Outlook
description: Crypto analyst and trader Jason Pizzino says that king crypto Bitcoin (BTC) is unlikely to revisit the 2022 lows. In a new video, Pizzino tells his 281,000 YouTube subscribers that while Bitcoin could drop further from current levels, it is likely to form a hâ€¦
content:
Crypto analyst and trader Jason Pizzino says that king crypto Bitcoin (BTC) is unlikely to revisit the 2022 lows.
In a new video, Pizzino tells his 281,000 YouTube subscribers that while Bitcoin couâ€¦ [+2456 chars]
content_full: Crypto analyst and trader Jason Pizzino says that king crypto Bitcoin (BTC) is unlikely to revisit the 2022 lows. In a new video, Pizzino tells his 281,000 YouTube subscribers that while Bitcoin could drop further from current levels, it is likely to form a higher low rather than go below the 2022 low of around $15,500.         â€œWeâ€™re not completely away from the $10,000. But as the market progresses and we potentially start to form a higher low, even though this market could fall, come back and test $18,000, $19,000, $20,000 that could be the higher low that weâ€™re all waiting for. For that sign of strength. The higher low is a sign of strength.â€ Bitcoin is trading for $21,643 at time of writing. According to Pizzino, hopes of Bitcoin falling to $10,000 will gradually disappear once the flagship crypto asset breaks above the August 2022 high of slightly over $25,000. â€œGoing back to these points here â€“ â€˜Bitcoin will go to $10,000â€™ â€“ weâ€™re still hearing that. But that will possibly and probably eventually fade if over the next month or two we do get this higher low and the market breaks away. Once these highs are broken [$25,000], the showâ€™s over. There is going to be a lot of pain to investors who are still waiting for any sort of $10,000 or $12,000 or $14,000 Bitcoin, maybe even a retest of $15,000. Those possibilities begin to fade a hell of a lot as we start to see some more of these signals come in.â€ The crypto analyst says his bullish thesis for Bitcoin will be invalidated if the flagship digital asset drops below the $18,000 support level. â€œI like Bitcoin between this level of $18,000 and $22,000. I am losing hope for the retest of $15,000. Therefore, I donâ€™t want to get greedy and wait for $15,000. So I will ladder back into the market in more of a pyramid fashionâ€¦ Iâ€™m looking at dropping more in on the way down. I think these levels are pretty good, between the sort of $18,000 and $22,000 because if Bitcoin drops underneath $18,000 then the structure changes. Weâ€™re dropping back below these previous support levels here â€¦ thatâ€™s around $18,500 and then down to $18,000, there are those previous bottoms. If it starts to drop underneath these levels, then we are left with a different structure. It can spike under there, but we donâ€™t want to see Bitcoin re-accumulate or start its price action back under these levels of $18,000. We definitely want to see it hold at least at $18,000 and start to work its way higher.â€  I Don't Miss a Beat â€“ Subscribe to get email alerts delivered directly to your inbox   Check Price Action  Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Telegram  Surf The Daily Hodl Mix           Check Latest News Headlines  Â         Disclaimer: Opinions expressed at The Daily Hodl are not investment advice. title: Polkadot (DOT) Price Prediction 2025-2030: DOT stagnates at $6 â€“ where to next?
description: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. In a spot of good news, unlike other crypto currencies, the price of Polkadot (DOT) has not â€¦
content:
Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
In a spot of good news, unlike oâ€¦ [+18233 chars]
content_full: Â Polkadot (DOT): An overviewSource: Polkadot.networkÂ Polkadot (DOT)Â is a multi-chain blockchain platform designed forÂ interoperability in the Web 3.0 era. Its core function is to bridge disparate blockchains, whether private, public, or permissionless, into a cohesive network.Â By allowing data transfer across any blockchain, Polkadot introduces scalability and security and broadens real-world applications. The platform envisions aÂ decentralized internetÂ where blockchains communicate trustlessly, encompassing not only existing networks but also future technologies.Â TheÂ DOT token is the native cryptocurrency of the Polkadot network. It serves multiple purposes within the ecosystem, playing a central role in both the operation and governance of the platform. Here are the primary uses and functionalities of the DOT token:Â Staking: Polkadot operates on aÂ Nominated Proof-of-Stake (NPoS) consensus mechanism. Token holders can stake their DOT to support the network's operation.Â Bonding: To secure a parachain slot on theÂ Relay Chain, projects must participate in parachainÂ slot auctions by locking up (or "bonding") a certain amount of DOT. If they win the auction, their DOT is bonded for the duration of theÂ parachain lease, after which it's returned. If they don't win, the DOT is returned.Â Governance:Â DOT holders have a say in the governance of the Polkadot network. This includes voting on protocol upgrades, changes, and various proposals. The DOT token allows its holders to influence the direction of the network's development, ensuring that decisions are decentralized and representative of the community's wishes.Â The supply of DOT varies with each era. It has anÂ inflationary nature, featuring a setÂ 10% yearly inflation rate, and there's no upper limit to its supply. This inflation rate can be modified via a referendum. The current circulating supply of DOT isÂ 1,230,119,743.Â The Polkadot ecosystemSource: Polkadot.networkÂ Below is a detailed breakdown of the network structure and how everything functions:Â TechnologySubstrate:Â This is a modular blockchain-building framework developed byÂ Parity Technologies. With Substrate, developers can create their ownÂ blockchains tailored to their use cases without having to code everything from scratch.Â WebAssembly (WASM):Â WASM is a binary instruction format designed as a portable target for the compilation of high-level languages like C, C++, and Rust, enabling deployment on the web and other environments.Â Polkadot utilizesÂ WASMÂ for its state machine, meaning that the logic that defines its blockchain (like how transactions are processed) is compiled into WASM. This allows for easy upgrades and flexibility, as new runtime versions can be deployed without requiring aÂ fork.Â libp2p: Developed by Protocol Labs (the same team behindÂ IPFS), libp2p is a modular network protocol stack that allows building your own peer-to-peer (P2P) applications.Â Polkadot employs libp2p for its networking layer, facilitating peer discovery and communications. It's a significant part of the decentralized nature of the platform.Â ArchitectureRelay chain:Â At the heart of Polkadot is the Relay chain, which is the central chain that provides security for the entire system. It handles consensus and finality and ensures that transactions acrossÂ parachains are consistently ordered.Â Parachains: Parachains are distinct blockchains that plug into the Relay chain and benefit from its security. Each parachain is optimized for its own specific use case, which means it can have different structures and governance models. The Relay chain coordinates all the parachains and ensures smooth interoperability between them.Â Parathreads:Â Similar to parachains,Â parathreads also benefit from the Relay chainâ€™s security and interoperability. The main difference is how they are connected to the Relay chain. Instead of having a continuous, dedicated slot like parachains, parathreads rent slots on aÂ per-block basis, making them a cost-effective option for projects that don't require continuous connectivity.Â Bridges:Â These are specialized blockchains (or modules on existing blockchains) that connect Polkadot with external blockchains, such asÂ Ethereum (ETH) orÂ Bitcoin (BTC). They enable communication and value transfer between Polkadot and these networks, facilitating cross-chain compatibility.Â Polkadot employs a unique consensus approach that's a blend of different concepts and mechanisms.Â NPoSProof-of-Stake (PoS)Â is a consensus mechanism where participants "stake" their tokens to become validators, which allows them to produce blocks and confirm transactions. The more tokens staked, the higher the chance to be chosen as a validator.Â In Polkadot's NPoS, there's an additional layer. Token holders can become "nominators" rather than validators. TheseÂ nominators can select a set of validator candidates they trust. The role of the nominator is to back certain validators with their own stakes as a sign of trust.Â This mechanism ensures that a broader community is involved in the validator selection process, making it more decentralized and secure.Â Hybrid consensusBlind Assignment for Blockchain Extension (BABE):Â BABE is the block production mechanism in Polkadot. Validators are randomly selected to produce blocks in a rotating manner.Â The "blind assignment" means that the selection of validators is unpredictable, ensuring that no single validator can monopolize block production. This randomness makes it difficult for malicious actors to predict and attack the network.Â GHOST-based Recursive Ancestor Deriving Prefix Agreement (GRANDPA):Â While BABE is about producing blocks quickly, GRANDPA is about ensuring theirÂ finality.Â GRANDPA achieves this by allowing validators to vote on chains and then finalizing entire chains at once instead of one block at a time. This mechanism provides high levels of security and ensures that once a transaction is finalized, it isÂ immutable.Â Roles within the ecosystemValidators: Responsible for validating and finalizing blocks on the Relay chain. They assessÂ collator proofs and produce and finalize blocks using staked DOT tokens.Nominators:Â Back validators by staking DOT tokens. They enhance network security, support trustworthy validators, and earn a portion ofÂ block rewards.Collators: Maintain parachains, collect transactions, and produce proofs for Relay chain validators. They facilitate accurate block validation.Fishermen:Â NetworkÂ watchdogs who monitor for malicious activities. They report dishonest actions, serving as the last line of defense in security.Â Interchain communicationPolkadot'sÂ Cross-Consensus Message Format (XCM) protocol facilitates inter-chain communication, allowing diverse blockchains to share messages and value. By using XCM, chains within the Polkadot ecosystem can seamlessly interact without relying on central trust.Â It underpins interoperability, supporting innovative cross-chain applications and over 600 projects in theÂ Web 3.0 ecosystem.Â GovernanceÂ Polkadot employs an advancedÂ on-chain governance model designed to be adaptable and upgradable without forking.Token holders who possess DOTs play a central role in governance. They can propose changes, vote on referenda, and even elect members to the Council.The Council is a specialized group of DOT holders responsible for representing passive stakeholders, proposing referenda, and guiding the platform's direction.There's also aÂ Technical Committee, composed of teams actively building Polkadot, which can propose emergency upgrades or changes.Together, these entities ensure that Polkadot evolves seamlessly with the community's collective preferences and needs.Â KusamaKusama is often described as a "canary network" for Polkadot, serving as an experimental, unrefined release of the Polkadot code. Its primary purpose is to provide a platform where developers can test new features and innovations in a real-world environment before they are introduced to the Polkadot network.Â While it shares many similarities with Polkadot, Kusama hasÂ faster governance parameters and lower barriers to entry, making it ideal for startups and developers looking to launch parachains or try out new concepts.Â History of PolkadotSource: Polkadot.networkÂ Gavin Wood, co-founder of Ethereum and author of its yellow paper, envisioned a multi-chain framework, proposing the idea forÂ Polkadot in a white paper in 2016. His vision centered around creating a web of blockchains that could operate interdependently yet seamlessly.Â In 2017, theÂ Web3 Foundation was founded by Wood, Ashley Tyson, and Peter Czaban. This institution was instrumental in driving the research, development, and popularization of decentralized web technologies, with Polkadot being a focal project.Â The following October, the foundation organized Polkadot's initial coin offering (ICO), which was highly successful, raisingÂ $145 million in less than two weeks.Â A major hurdle arose when a notable portion of the raised funds was locked and rendered inaccessible due to aÂ Parity wallet bug. This unfortunate incident delayed the development timeline for Polkadot. However, the team remained undeterred.Â In the wake of the Parity bug, the Web3 Foundation orchestrated aÂ private sale, successfully raising the necessary funds to continue with Polkadot's development milestones.Â In 2019, theÂ Kusama network was launched, followed by the launch of theÂ Rococo testnet in 2020.Â Polkadot's mainnet was progressively rolled out, starting with aÂ Proof-of-Authority (PoA) mode where operations were overseen by the Web3 Foundation.Â This was a preliminary phase before transitioning to a more decentralizedÂ PoS mode, which hands control over to the network validators. In May 2020, it finally went live.

Aptos (APT) is one of the cryptocurrencies having a more pleasant Saturday as it is up by more than 3% at publishing time. According to the crypto market tracking website CoinMarketCap, APT is currently trading hands at $13.39 after a 3.20% increase in price over the last 24 hours.  APT / Tether US 1D (Source: CoinMarketCap) APT reached a high of $13.74 and a low of $12.67 over the same time period. The crypto is, however, still in the red by more than 18% over the last week.  The altcoin was able to strengthen against Bitcoin (BTC) and Ethereum (ETH) over the last day by about 4.14% and 5.16% respectively. APTâ€™s 24 hour trading volume is in the red zone and now stands at $680,832,140 after a more than 21% decrease since yesterday. With its market cap of $2,178,102,478, AOT is currently ranked as the 30th biggest crypto in terms of market capitalization. This places it right behind Hedera (HBAR) in the 29th position and in front of Filecoin (FIL) â€¦ The post Aptos (APT) Price Is Up By 3+% And Could Still Climb Higher appeared first on Coin Edition. See original on CoinEdition

In an emailed statement, a PayPal representative said: â€œWe are exploring a stablecoin; if and when we seek to move forward, we will of course, work closely with relevant regulators.â€Â  The Popularity And Use Cases Of Stablecoins Stablecoins are digital currencies developed to keep a consistent value relative to another asset, often a fiat currency such as the dollar or euro. In recent years, they have grown in popularity due to their ability to combine the benefits of cryptocurrencies, such as swift and inexpensive cross-border transactions, with the stability of traditional fiat currencies. Image: Investopedia This makes them an appealing alternative to volatile cryptocurrencies such as Bitcoin and Ethereum. In the fast expanding world of cryptocurrencies, the rising popularity of stablecoins has been driven by the demand for a more stable and dependable method of transaction. Meanwhile, the recent failure of several of the cryptocurrency marketâ€™s top participants, particularly FTX, has eroded investor trust in what was once considered the next big thing in finance. A halt in the creation of PayPalâ€™s stablecoin follows a slew of recent regulatory actions against crypto businesses. According to an unidentified source who spoke with Bloomberg, the action forced the payments company to cease its pursuit of its own coin.  Crypto total market cap at $966 billion on the weekend chart | Chart: TradingView.com Related Reading: On Crypto And Discrimination: Mississippi Passes Bill Protecting Crypto Minersâ€™ Rights In the past two years, PayPal has made a serious foray into cryptocurrency, enabling users to purchase Bitcoin, Ethereum, Bitcoin Cash, and Litecoin using its digital wallet. In January last year, PayPalÂ announced its intention to study the creation of its own stablecoin. This was long before crypto giants such as Celsius, Voyager, and most notoriously FTX went insolvent and crumbled in the following months. -Featured image from Small Business Trends

author: Suzuki Shillsalot
title: Terra LUNA Classic [LUNC] Price Prediction 2025-2030: LUNC falls by 22%, but thereâ€™s still hope
description: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. The price of Terra Luna Classic (LUNC) has dropped by 11% within the past 24 hours, amid a wâ€¦
content:
Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
The price of Terra Luna Classic â€¦ [+10181 chars]
content_full: Â Terra Luna Classic (LUNC): An overviewSource: LUNC classic community/TwitterÂ Terra, now known asÂ Terra Luna ClassicÂ (LUNC), is an open-source blockchain protocol for hosting a dynamic ecosystem ofÂ decentralized applications (dApps) and top-tier development tools. It is built on theÂ Cosmos SDK. The blockchain carves a path for the next-genÂ decentralized financeÂ (DeFi) experience by harnessing aÂ proof-of-stakeÂ (PoS) consensus mechanism calledÂ Tendermint.Â The networkâ€™s native token,Â LUNC, is mainly used for staking. Apart from this, it can also be used for governance that allows users to make changes to the Terra protocol.Â Â It is also a payment platform for anÂ algorithmic stablecoin, and its chief role was to serve the purpose of a â€œcounterpartâ€ in absorbing price fluctuations ofÂ terraUSD (UST), which is now known asÂ Terra Classic USD (USTC).Â The attack that changed it allPost an attack that exploited a loophole in the blockchain's protocol, UST failed to aptly mint and burn its tokens to create a balance of its demand and supply at theÂ $1 peg. Subsequent to losing its dollar peg, UST witnessed aÂ catastrophic [almost 99%] loss of value, one that has gone down the history of major crypto collapses.Â Â The resultant events led Do Kwon to rev up the revival efforts. In doing so, he proposed aÂ hard fork for which the majority of the community members voted in favor.Thus, two Terra blockchains now function parallelly:The original Terra blockchain with the token rebranded toÂ â€œLuna Classic (LUNC).â€Â A newly launched blockchain protocol calledÂ Terra 2.0Â  with its native token calledÂ â€œLUNA.â€The aim ofÂ Terra 2.0Â was to inherit all the protocols and applications of the former network. There was also a significant update related to the network's stablecoins.Â Â All of the original network stablecoins, includingÂ UST,Â KRT, andÂ EUT, underwent a renaming process. They were then known asÂ Terra Classic stablecoins, designated asÂ USTC,Â KRTC, andÂ EUTC, respectively.Â Â Notably, the new blockchain iteration did not feature anyÂ "Terra" branded stablecoins. This distinction further differentiated the original from the new chain, reinforcing the legacy of the former while setting the stage for the innovations and offerings of the latter.Â What does LUNC's road ahead look like?Source: LUNC classic community/TwitterÂ Community sentimentDespite the crumbling of its network, LUNC's community exhibited promising signs of revival asÂ â€œ#LUNCcommunityâ€Â was trending on Twitter.Â Â The community aided the coin's recovery by passing critical proposals onÂ  LUNC's burn in the hope of recouping the losses of the previous meltdown.Â While Kwon and his team focused on the developmental aspects ofÂ Terra 2.0, Luna Classic was handed over and is now run by its community.Â Effects of LUNC's burn taxIn an effort to redress the damages from over-minting, the community initiated a token burn mechanism. This initiative began with a burn rate ofÂ 1.2% for every LUNC transaction, aiming to reduce the supply fromÂ 6.8 trillion toÂ 10 billion. The intention was not just to limit supply but to bolster its demand and value, especially in the aftermath of a substantial market crash.Â Validators took a front seat in orchestrating this reduction, and their efforts didn't go unnoticed. A surge in social mentions and engagement, particularly on platforms likeÂ LunarCrush, indicated a positive response from the community.Â Major exchanges, namelyÂ Binance andÂ KuCoin, stepped up, backing the burn mechanism, which, in turn, sent encouraging signals to other platforms to support LUNC's recovery. This amalgamation of social traction and exchange support set the stage for the cryptocurrency's potential growth.Â Since May 2022, aroundÂ 74.91 billion LUNC have been burned. While the initial burn rate wasÂ 1.2% per transaction, an adjustment saw it drop toÂ 0.2%, aiming to invigorate blockchain activity.Â Â However, this rate wasn't impactful enough on the circulating supply. Recognizing this, a proposal was made in March 2023, and by May of the same year, the burn rate was elevated toÂ 0.5%. As of September 2023, 5.82 trillion LUNC are in circulation.Â Whatâ€™s happening with USTC?TheÂ Terra LUNA Classic community recently voted in favor ofÂ suspending the minting of USTC. The primary concern was theÂ USTC-LUNA swap mechanism, which allowed users to easily exchangeÂ UST andÂ LUNA. However, this method became problematic during financial crises.Â Â To safeguard investor interests, a proposal was made to discontinue this swapping mechanism. This proposal is essentially an attempt to restore the coinâ€™s peg to theÂ U.S. dollar.Â History of TerraSource: Terra.moneyÂ The Terra blockchain was developed byÂ Terraform Labs.Â The company was founded by Daniel Shin and Kwon and debuted inÂ January 2018. Following its introduction, anÂ Initial Coin Offering (ICO) for its native token, LUNA, was conducted in early 2019. Terra's exceptional performance in the subsequent years propelled it into theÂ top 10 largest cryptocurrencies globally based on market capitalization.Â Terra's white paper elucidates the vision of its founders: they aspired to actualizeÂ Bitcoinâ€™sÂ (BTC) initial ambition â€“ a decentralized peer-to-peer electronic cash system. In their pursuit of this vision, they devised a unique approach using stablecoins.Â Â Before co-founding Terra, Shin's entrepreneurial journey included launchingÂ Ticket Monster (TMON), a prominent e-commerce entity in South Korea. He later co-initiated Fast Track Asia, an incubator assisting entrepreneurs in sculpting their fledgling companies into robust enterprises.Â On the other hand, Kwon's resume boasts the founding of Anyfi, a startup dedicated to decentralized wireless mesh networking solutions. He has further sharpened his skills during stints as a software engineer with industry giants likeÂ Microsoft andÂ Apple.
