author: Suzuki Shillsalot
title: Algorand (ALGO) Price Prediction 2025-2030: ALGO falls below resistance level toâ€¦
description: Disclaimer:Â The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. Since reaching an all-time high of $2.99 in November 2021, the price of Algorand (ALGO) fellâ€¦
content:
Disclaimer:Â The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
Since reaching an all-time high â€¦ [+15244 chars]
content_full: Â Algorand (ALGO): An overviewSource: Algorand/TwitterÂ Algorand (ALGO) is a decentralized, public blockchain platform designed to address some of the main challenges faced by legacy blockchain systems, particularly in terms of scalability, security, and decentralization.Â The blockchain platform aims to create aÂ borderless economy where everyone can participate equitably and transparently. To achieve this, Algorand offers a plethora of features:Â Scalability: Algorand is built to handle a high throughput of transactions, rivaling major global payment gateways. This scalability ensures that as adoption grows, the network remains efficient.Â Â On Algorand, everyÂ 3.3 seconds, a block is generated, accommodating up to 25,000 transactions. This leads to a transaction capacity of approximatelyÂ 7,500 transactions per second (TPS).Â Smart contracts: While also offering smart contract functionality, Algorand opens doorways forÂ decentralized applicationsÂ (dApps). This function makes the blockchain useful for financial services,Â decentralized finance (DeFi), institutions, and ultimately for the users.Â Atomic swaps: Additionally, atomic swaps allow for instantaneous cross-chain exchanges, increasing interoperability.Â Two-tiered structure:Â Algorand employs a dual-layerÂ blockchain architecture to balance rapid performance with the demands of complex applications. The foundational layer,Â Layer 1, facilitates the creation ofÂ Algorand Standard Assets (ASA), which can represent novel or pre-existing tokens on the chain, as well as enable atomic swaps and basic smart contracts on Algorand.Â On the other hand, the advancedÂ Layer 2 is tailored for intricate smart contracts andÂ dApps that operate off-chain.Â Developer tools: For developers, Algorand offers the flexibility to author smart contracts using Python. Additionally, to integrate with on-chain assets or applications, they can choose from one of the four available SDKs:Â Python,Â JavaScript,Â Golang, orÂ Java.Â Open-source nature: The Algorand protocol is entirelyÂ open-source. This transparency fosters innovation and community collaboration and ensures the platform's trustworthiness and adaptability for future technological advancements.Â ALGOSource: Algorand/TwitterÂ ALGO is the native coin of Algorand's blockchain. As a versatile coin within the crypto space, it has several use cases:Transaction fees:Â The coin is used to pay transaction fees on the Algorand network.On-chain purchases: ALGO is used for buying on-chain items, includingÂ non-fungible tokens (NFTs).Goods and services: It is used as a form of payment for various goods and services.DeFi: ALGO holders can participate in variousÂ DeFi activities, both as users and investors.Governance participation: Holders of ALGO can participate in the governance of the Algorand network, making decisions about its future direction.Consensus mechanism:Â ALGO is also essential for securing consensus among participation nodes.The maximum supply for ALGO is fixed atÂ 10 billion. Even though all coins were pre-mintedÂ at the network's inception, the circulating supply will gradually increase as these pre-minted coins are unlocked and distributed over time. As of September 2023,Â 7,832,296,592 ALGOs are in circulation.Â Q1 2023 signified theÂ Algorand Governance Period 6. During this period, governors decided on the allocation ofÂ 68.2 million ALGO, split as follows:General governance:Â 53.2 million ALGOGeneral DeFi rewards:Â 15.0 million ALGOTo ensure sustainable growth and a transparent future, theÂ Algorand Foundation introduced a revised long-termÂ Algo Dynamics model. This model is intended to guide the platform's progress over a period extending beyond a decade, potentially up to the yearÂ 2030.Â How does Algorand work?Source: Algorand.comÂ Algorand operates using a unique approach that stands out in the blockchain space, primarily leveraging itsÂ Pure Proof-of-Stake (PPoS) consensus mechanism and its dual-node structure comprising relay and participation nodes.Â PPoSÂ UnlikeÂ Proof-of-Work (PoW), which involves computational puzzles, Algorand uses the unique PPoS algorithm.Â For each round of block generation, a committee of token holders is randomly selected to propose and validate a block. The likelihood of being chosen relates to the number of ALGOsÂ they hold. This selection process is secretive, minimizing the risk of attacks.Â Once a block is added to the chain in Algorand, it's final. This eliminatesÂ forks and provides certainty about transactions.Â Relay nodesRelay nodes serve as the primaryÂ communication infrastructureÂ for the network. They are responsible for transferring data (like transactions and blocks) efficiently across the network.Â Relay nodes connect to multiple other nodes, both relay and participation, ensuring data propagates rapidly and reliably.Â Participation nodesThese nodes actively participate in the PPoS consensus process. They can be chosen toÂ propose a block or to be part of the committee thatÂ validates andÂ votes on a block.Â Participation nodes predominantly communicate with the network through relay nodes, acting as a second layer that engages directly in the consensus process.Â Algorandâ€™s journeySource: Algorand.foundationÂ The primary inventor behind Algorand is Silvio Micali, a Turing Award-winning cryptographer and a professor at MIT. Micali co-authored the AlgorandÂ white paper with Jing Chen in 2017.Â TheÂ Algorand Foundation, based in Singapore, has been the primary force in supporting and funding the research and advancement of the Algorand protocol. In 2019, Algorand'sÂ mainnetÂ was launched, and its first auction took place, marking the beginning of its public existence.Â In September 2021, the blockchain announced the launch of its Layer 1 protocol:Â Algorand Virtual Machine.Â In the following November, the momentum continued as the network witnessed the introduction ofÂ Algomint, the next-generation DeFi infrastructure. This project bridged popular assets to and from other blockchains to the Algorand blockchain.

author: U.Today
title: Scam Alert: Most Hyped Cardano AI Token Involved in Fake Airdrop
description: Fake copy of AGIX, core utility and governance cryptocurrency for Cardano-friendly AI team SingularityNET, is promoted by scammers
content: Despite SingularityNET (AGIX) being among the oldest AI projects in cryptocurrency it launched in 2018 impersonators are sure that it still needs one more airdrop to get user attention. Here's why itâ€¦ [+1464 chars]
content_full: Despite SingularityNET (AGIX) being among the oldest AI projects in cryptocurrency â€” it launched in 2018 â€” impersonators are sure that it still needs one more airdrop to get user attention. Here's why it is dangerous. Alert: Scammers launched fake AGIX airdrop On Feb. 9, 2023, an airdrop campaign was being promoted on Twitter. Malefactors announced thatÂ SingularityNET organized a token airdrop for its AGI asset. In fact, AGI was rebranded as AGIX over a year ago. Image via Twitter The scammers created a Linktree landing page that closely mimics the original SingularityNET's one. They use real videos by the founders ofÂ SingularityNET and Cardano's (ADA) Input Output Global, but the page is linked to a phishing site. It asks visitors to bind their wallets on both Cardano (ADA) and Ethereum (ETH) blockchains, which, of course, cannot be achieved through a single smart contract.       Ads        Ads     The Twitter account involved in the promotion of this token has also nothing to do with real representatives ofÂ SingularityNET (AGIX) on social media. AGIX rallied by 10x in less than month The platform has no publicly known officers with the name the scammers chose for the account. Unfortunately, besides bots and malefactors, some real Cardano (ADA) enthusiasts have fallen to this scam and retweeted the announcement. As covered by U.Today previously,Â SingularityNET (AGIX) is among the core beneficiaries of the ongoing AI hype wave. Its token is one of the best performers in the segment. Since Nov. 30, 2022 (the release of ChatGPT and the start date of the AI/ML euphoria in crypto), the token added over 900%. Its local peak was registered a week ago over $0.6.

author: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
title: Bitcoin logo imperfection found on original artwork after 12 years
description: While Bitcoiners preach the â€œzoom outâ€ narrative during crypto bear markets, zooming in on the original Bitcoin logo shows a small orange line from the background going into the white colored â€œâ‚¿.â€
content: While Satoshi Nakamoto is credited as the anonymous creator of Bitcoin (BTC), what often goes unnoticed are the selfless contributions of the community members miners, developers, designers, hodlers â€¦ [+2134 chars]
content_full: While Satoshi Nakamoto is credited as the anonymous creator of Bitcoin (BTC), what often goes unnoticed are the selfless contributions of the community members â€” miners, developers, designers, hodlers and investors â€” that help materialize the original vision. However, one such significant contribution was found to carry an imperfection for over 12 years, invisible to the naked eye.On Nov. 12, 2010, bitcointalk.org member bitboy (not related to YouTuber BitBoy Crypto) posted the vector files of the iconic Bitcoin logo, which has been widely accepted worldwide. While Bitcoiners preach the â€œzoom outâ€ narrative during crypto bear markets, zooming in on the original Bitcoin logo shows a small orange line from the background going into the white colored â€œâ‚¿.â€A small design detail that has stayed with many iterations of the original #bitcoin logo since its inception in 2010 pic.twitter.com/nYElwD2S6vâ€” Doc (@_Bosch_) February 9, 2023  The information was first revealed by Crypto Twitter member @_Bosch_, who then shared an updated Bitcoin logo after removing the mark and improving the stylistic proportions. On further investigation, community member @skyler_fs found that one of the curvatures of the â‚¿ logo was not smooth either.Cointelegraphâ€™s investigation of the above claims confirmed the imperfections sported by the original Bitcoin vectors. The image below shows the two locations where the microscopic design issues exist.Two imperfections found in the Bitcoin logo after 14 years. Source: CointelegraphThe revelation does not impact how Bitcoin operates and community members have not shown any concerns about it. Even if someone were to create new vectors after fixing the flaws, it would not gain mainstream acceptance unless the community decides otherwise.Related: Is it possible to achieve financial freedom with Bitcoin?As markets maintain a positive trajectory toward recovery, Bitcoin mining firm CleanSpark continues to amass equipment from distressed mining companies. CleanSparkâ€™s chief financial officer Gary Vecchiarelli said that the company envisions â€œexplosive growthâ€ in 2023 through mergers and acquisitions.â€œWith respect to our strategy regarding M&A, we have been one of the most active miners to date in acquiring infrastructure and machines, and we will continue to be active,â€ he added.

author: Suzuki Shillsalot
title: Binance Coin (BNB) Price Prediction 2025-2030: BNB meanders above $300 despite burning
description: Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. Binance Coin (BNB) is a digital currency launched by the worldâ€™s largest crypto exchange, Biâ€¦
content:
Disclaimer: The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
Binance Coin (BNB) is a digital â€¦ [+15143 chars]
content_full: Â Binance Coin (BNB): An overviewSource: Binance.comÂ BNB is the native token of theÂ Binance ecosystem that powers theÂ BNB Chain ecosystem. It was initially issued as anÂ ERC-20 token on theÂ Ethereum (ETH) platform, but it was later transferred to the main BNB Chain. Within the Binance Exchange ecosystem, BNB is used as a utility token, allowing users to receive discounts when paying for their trading fees.Â BNB Chain is the result of the merger ofÂ Binance Chain andÂ Binance Smart Chain. With a mission to build the infrastructure powering the world's parallel virtual ecosystem, BNB Chain has committed itself to be open, multi-chain, permissionless, endlessly decentralized for creators and inventors, and bigger than and separate from Binance.Â The evolution of BNBÂ Source: Binance.comÂ Formerly known asÂ Binance Coin, BNB, which stands for "Build and Build," was created by Binance in 2017. Changpeng Zhao, akaÂ CZ, is a Chinese-Canadian business executive. He is the co-founder and CEO of Binance, which is the world's largest cryptocurrency exchange by trading volume.Â The altcoin was issued and launched during an Initial Coin Offering (ICO) crowdfunding event that happened between June 26 and July 3.Â 100,000,000 units of BNB, which is 50% of the total supply, were offered by the token sale.Â Here's a look into BNB's timeline:In February 2019, Binance launched theÂ DEX testnet for the new era of peer-to-peer cryptocurrency tradingIn April 2019, theÂ Binance Chain mainnet was launched with pre-selected validators producing blocksIn April 2019, theÂ ERC-20 mainnet swap took place, with BNB swapped for BEP2 tokensIn September 2020, theÂ Binance Smart ChainÂ (BSC) was launchedIn December 2021, theÂ BNB Auto-Burn, a new protocol for the quarterly BNB burn, was introducedIn February 2022, theÂ BNB Chain was introducedÂ Other key developmentsSource: Binance AcademyÂ Binance has been so successful in its journey that it has become synonymous with crypto. Here's a look into some of Binance's important developments in the past few years:In April 2020, Binance acquiredÂ CoinMarketCap, one of the most visited crypto websites in the worldIn July 2020, Binance acquiredÂ Swipe, a leading multi-asset digital wallet and Visa debit card platformIn September 2020, Binance launchedÂ Liquid Swap, a trading platform that hosts different pools of liquidity, allowing users to exchange crypto assets and earn from their pooled fundsIn December 2020, Binance launched theÂ Combined Convert and OTC Trading PortalIn December 2020, Binance entered into a new strategic partnership withÂ ChilizIn May 2021,Â Metamask added built-in PancakeSwap's swap feature, enabling users to access BNB Chain tokens seamlesslyIn July 2021,Â Ethereum World News reported that BNB Chain was the most used blockchain in Q2In August 2021,Â Deri Protocol launched the first permissionless derivatives market on the BNB ChainIn September 2021,Â PowerPool, the firstÂ BNB Chain DeFiIndex, went live on BNB ChainIn October 2021, BNB Chain surpassedÂ 100 million unique addressesIn November 2021,Â BNB Chain Testnet underwent a hard fork to undergo an upgrade toÂ Bruno releaseIn November 2021, a revolutionaryÂ BNB Chain v1.1.5 upgrade called Bruno, withÂ BEP95 real-time burn mechanism, was deployed on theÂ BNB Chain mainnetIn December 2021,Â Chainlink Keepers was launched on theÂ BNB Chain mainnetIn December 2021,Â Ankr implemented theÂ Erigon client toÂ BNB Chain mainnetIn September 2022,Â BUSD reached a market cap milestone ofÂ $20 billionIn October 2022, Binance secured a permanent license to offer digital asset services in KazakhstanIn November 2022, Binance partnered withÂ Ledger to enable even smoother crypto purchasesIn December 2022,Â Binance Pay partnered withÂ Pyypl to bring users a more secure online transaction experienceIn January 2023, the BNB Beacon Chain testnet underwent theÂ Einstein upgrade, which incorporated two scheduled hard forksIn April 2023, the BNB Greenfield launched its newest testnet namedÂ CongoIn April 2023, the BNB Smart Chain mainnet had a hard fork namedÂ PlanckIn June 2023, the BNB Smart Chain testnet was upgraded. This significant transformation included three simultaneous hard forks namedÂ Hertz,Â London, andÂ BerlinIn June 2023, the BNB Smart Chain launched theÂ opBNB testnet, a groundbreaking scalability solutionBy September 2023, theÂ opBNB mainnet had been successfully launched and was fully operational

author: Suzuki Shillsalot
title: VeChain (VET) Price Prediction 2025-2030: Unassuming VET falls toâ€¦
description: Disclaimer:Â The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptoâ€™s own research on the subject. VeChain (VET) is a blockchain platform that seeks to revolutionize the world of supply and lâ€¦
content:
Disclaimer:Â The datasets shared in the following article have been compiled from a set of online resources and do not reflect AMBCryptos own research on the subject.
VeChain (VET) is a blockchain plâ€¦ [+16596 chars]
content_full: Â VeChain (VET): An overviewSource: Vechain.orgÂ VeChain (VET) is an open-source, smart contract-compatibleÂ blockchain that seeks to streamline supply chain processes and information flow and solve real-world business problems. UsingÂ distributed ledger technology (DLT),Â VeChain aims to enhance business processes and promote the mass adoption of blockchain technology. The VET tokens serve as the native cryptocurrency of the blockchain.Â Like many other cryptocurrencies, the maximum supply of VET coins is capped atÂ 86.71 billion VET. Currently, there areÂ 72.71 billion VET in circulation. These coins are used for transactions, executing smart contracts, and other functions on the blockchain.Â Even after being a significant technological advancement,Â Ethereum (ETH) still remains incapable of runningÂ large-scale commercial decentralized applications (dApps). Also, the lack of a suitable economic model proves to be a barrier for companies looking to operate their dApps at a controlled and predictable cost.Â To address these issues,Â VeChain uses an on-chain governance mechanism, meta-transaction features, aÂ proof-of-authorityÂ (PoA)Â consensus mechanism, and a unique two-token system.The community-electedÂ steering committee supports the on-chain governance process by facilitating decision-making and execution. Nodeholders vote openly to choose the committee.Meta-transaction features include multi-party payment, multi-task transaction, controllable transaction lifecycle, and transaction dependency.PoA solves the numerous problems with energy waste and inefficient renovations that businesses encounter. It helps process large transaction volumes rapidly and can avoid hard forks if they are not upgraded byÂ authority masternodes.Â There areÂ 101 masternodes on the blockchain.The unique two-token system (VET+VTHO) significantly helps to isolate the price volatility and separate the cost of using blockchain from market speculation. Value is stored and transferred using VET, while blockchain transactions are made using VTHO.The blockchain is also highly scalable and sustainable.Â VeChain Thor allows a transaction to carry out multiple tasks or clauses to promote scalability and facilitate complex transactions. The energy consumption is also equal toÂ 0.04% of other blockchains.Â VeChain's journeySource: Vechain.orgÂ Sunny Lu, a former chief information officer for Louis Vuitton China, and Jay Zhang co-founded VeChain inÂ 2015. It was founded as a subsidiary ofÂ Bitse, one of the biggest blockchain businesses in China, and is one of the few blockchains having a significant base of established businesses as customers.Â Initially, the VEN token operated on the Ethereum blockchain. In 2017, the VeChain team held a crowd sale in which it soldÂ 1 billionÂ coins and raised $20 million, distributing its cryptocurrency,Â VEN, for the first time.Â The VeChain protocol, which was initially only intended to address supply chain management, was rebranded toÂ VeChain Thorâ€”a blockchain-as-a-service (BaaS) platform inÂ 2018. This rebranding expanded the range of dApps to cover more general data solutions.Â When the rebranded blockchain was introduced, the tokens were later replaced withÂ VET coins. The coming developments were called theÂ Apotheosis by theÂ VeChain Foundation, during which they expected VeChain to reach new highs.Â The blockchain platform's objectives are outlined in its white paper. Its primary goal was to upend the supply chain sector by making data transparent and usable. It also intends to be a pioneer in VeChain-based dApps and initial coin offerings (ICOs), as well as anÂ Internet of Things (IoT) intermediary.In February 2023, VeChain announced the launch of its new fullyÂ decentralized crypto wallet: VeWorld. This wallet allows users to carry out a number of crypto-related tasks, including maintaining crypto portfolios, transferring and receiving crypto assets, securely transacting on decentralized applications, and managing crypto in conjunction with a Ledger hardware device.Â How does VeChain function?With the use ofÂ RFID (radio frequency identification),Â QR Codes,Â or NFC, VeChain enables the identification of physical items with a unique identity. Sensors gather information, which is then collected and linked to the product identity at every stage of the supply chain. These sensors are produced by companies likeÂ BoschÂ andÂ Qualcomm.Â Since it employs blockchain technology, the data becomes immutable. The blockchain record also identifies the precise location of any errors with regard to the location, authenticity, etc. Information on the product can be viewed on VeChain by both the company and the customer.Â These features are crucial for combating fraud. The sensors or chips are assigned unique IDs or QR codes. They are then inserted inside products, which can be scanned to access all the information from production to delivery. Even after a certain item is sold, the chip remains and enables reselling and verification of authentic items.Â The blockchain uses a two-token system. Both of these coins are crucial for it to operate:VET is the native cryptocurrency and serves as a value-transfer medium. By keeping VET coins in their wallets, holders can also earn VTHO. The amount of VTHO received depends on the quantity of VET retained and the length of the holding period. When it comes to leveraging the resources of the blockchain, the more VET a person or business possesses the greater priority.VTHO is a secondary token that is used to cover the cost of executing transactions and smart contracts. In the VeChainThor blockchain, VTHO is used to pay transaction fees and is burnt when the transaction is completed.Â Other developmentsÂ Source: Vechain.orgÂ Some of the important developments/milestones of VeChain are as follows:April 2019: The platform launchedÂ Toolchain, a blockchain-based platform for businesses to develop their own supply chain solutions.July 2021: WithÂ VIP-193 completely operational, the VeChain Foundation launched its brand-new public testnet. This significant accomplishment paved the way for the complete implementation ofÂ PoA 2.0 on the mainnet.May 2022:Â VeUSDâ€”the network's first native stablecoin, was launched. It was developed in collaboration withÂ Stably. The stablecoin is aÂ VIP-180 token, a subset of theÂ ERC-2O standard.November 2022: VeChainThor completed the POA2.0 upgrade, which introduced finality as well as additional security mechanisms into the network.February 2023: The VeChain network exceeded 2 million known addresses and enabled more thanÂ 20,000 contracts, making this a major milestone.March 2023: VeChain completed its integration WithÂ DappRadar, the world's largest global dApp store and cross-chain dApp community.April 2023: The platform launched itsÂ Web 3.0 as a service platformâ€”VORJ.September 2023: VeWorldâ€™s mobile version was launched.

author: Reuters
title: G20 exploring cryptocurrency regulation, India's finance minister says
description: G20 exploring cryptocurrency regulation, India's finance minister says
content:
By Nikunj Ohri
(Reuters) - The Group of 20 (G20) big economies is exploring whether the group could collectively regulate cryptocurrencies, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Saturday.
Givâ€¦ [+1020 chars]
content_full: By Nikunj Ohri (Reuters) - The Group of 20 (G20) big economies is exploring whether the group could collectively regulate cryptocurrencies, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said on Saturday. Given the sophisticated technologies involved with these virtual assets, countries must discuss whether a given regulation is needed, said Sitharaman, whose country is this year's G20 president. Prime Minister Narendra Modi's government has for several years debated drafting a law to regulate or even ban cryptocurrencies but has not made a final decision. "We are talking to all nations, that if it requires regulation, then one country alone cannot do anything," Sitharaman told reporters after meeting the central bank's directors in New Delhi. "We are talking with all nations, if we can make some standard operating procedure which is followed by everyone to make a regulatory framework, and if it can be effective.  India will host G20 finance ministers and central bank governors this month. Last year, Modi has said a collective global effort is needed to deal with problems posed by cryptocurrencies. The Reserve Bank of India has said that cryptocurrencies should be banned as they are akin to a Ponzi scheme.

The anonymous host of the InvestAnswers channel tells his 441,000 YouTube subscribers in a new video that the blockchain data indexing protocol, The Graph (GRT), is the massively dominant search engine of decentralized networks.         â€œNow [The] Graph got my attention over two years ago because it is the Google of blockchain and Web3 needs transparency.â€ According to the InvestAnswersâ€™ host, The Graph could surge by around 521% from current levels during the next bull season. â€œI believe The Graph could go over $1 for the next bull run. And remember, that could start six months from now, 14 months from now, or a year and a half from now.  But I do believe it will go over $1 which is a 7X from the current price, which is kind of crazy to think. Itâ€™s risky, but the rewards are there.â€ The Graph is worth $0.161 at time of writing. The host of InvestAnswers, however, says that investors should avoid putting their money on the blockchain data indexing protocol based on a fear of missing out (FOMO). The Graph is up by over 200% since November of 2022 when it hit an all-time low of $0.052. â€œ[The Graph] took a huge run. Itâ€™s gone up to 3x in a very short window of time. Itâ€™s coming back off of that euphoria as with all the other names going up 800%, 900%. So not financial advice, but sit tight. author: Paul L.
title: We asked ChatGPT to explain Bitcoin in a rap song and itâ€™s dope
description:
The ChatGPT chatbot continues to gain prominence over its ability to handle different tasks by providing detailed responses and clear â€¦ Continued
The post We asked ChatGPT to explain Bitcoin in a rap song and itâ€™s dope appeared first on Finbold.
content: The ChatGPT chatbot continues to gain prominence over its ability to handle different tasks by providing detailed responses and clear answers across various fields of expertise. Some of the emerging â€¦ [+2474 chars]
content_full: The ChatGPT chatbot continues to gain prominence over its ability to handle different tasks by providing detailed responses and clear answers across various fields of expertise.  Some of the emerging roles of the text-based artificial intelligence (AI) tool include offering specific crypto price predictions and writing songs with lyrics covering diverse themes and genres.Â  Indeed, Finbold tasked ChatGPT with the role of explaining Bitcoin (BTC) in the form of rap music. As it stands, the tool did not disappoint by compressing all information about Bitcoin to align with the features of rap music.Â  In its explanation, ChatGPT incorporated elements such as rhyme schemes, repetition to emphasize certain points, and storytelling to creative wordplay.Â  Rapping about Bitcoin      At the start, the AI tool made it clear it was about to tell a story about Bitcoin, stressing that the asset is a real deal and not just a â€˜gameâ€™:  â€œListen up, yâ€™all I got a story to tell About a currency thatâ€™s making waves doing well Itâ€™s called Bitcoin, and itâ€™s changing the game A decentralized system with no one to blameâ€  For the chorus, ChatGPT summed up Bitcoin as secure, with no possibility of third-party interference, while noting that the maiden crypto is the â€˜future of gainsâ€™. ChatGPT Bitcoin rap lyrics. Source: ChatGPT Under the second verse, the AI tool opted to offer a history lesson on the emergence of Bitcoin, highlighting the year of creation and the anonymity around the assetâ€™s innovator:  â€œIt started in 2009, with a mysterious creator Satoshi Nakamoto, the name of the innovatorÂ  The idea was simple, create a new coin A digital currency that can easily be joinedâ€  Furthemore, ChatGPT used its lyrical prowess to give a word of caution for investors hoping to get rich quickly by buying Bitcoin. The tool warned that crypto markets remain highly volatile and caution should be observed:  â€œBut itâ€™s not all sunshine, itâ€™s a volatile ride It can go up and down, you gotta hold on tight But itâ€™s a long-term play, not a get-rich-quick scheme Invest wisely, and you can make your dreams come true, it seemsâ€  Finally, for the outro, ChatGPTsâ€™ Bitcoin rap sums up everything by advising on investing in the crypto and joining the revolution:Â   â€œSo thatâ€™s the story of Bitcoin, a currency of the future, Join the revolution, donâ€™t be a loser, Invest wisely, and see your wealth grow, Bitcoin, Bitcoin, itâ€™s the way to goâ€  Conclusion Although ChatGPT rap lyrics appear entertaining, the tool does not miss the opportunity to educate about Bitcoin. From the lyrics, itâ€™s clear that the AI tool understands the potential benefits to risks associated with Bitcoin.Â  These attributes also play out when the tool is tasked with describing Bitcoin in other forms. For example, ChatGPT remained educational and comical when we asked to explain Bitcoin like a 1920s monster.

The last eligibility option is specifically for people who live in North Carolina, South Carolina, Virginia, Georgia, or Tennessee).Â                                      Can you get 5.00% APY on a CD?Â                                 Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       Yes, several financial institutions have CDs paying 5.00% APY or more. Some examples include (but are not limited to) Raisin, Credit Human, and TotalDirectBank.                                     Are 10-year CD rates worth it?Â                                 Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       When choosing a CD term, you'll want to consider the timeline of your goal. That said, not many financial institutions offer 10-year CDs, and the rates for short-term CDs are actually better than long-term CDs right now. You could build a CD ladder if you want to diversify your CDs and open multiple terms for more flexibility.                                     What is a CD?                                Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       A CD is a time-sensitive savings account that holds your money at a fixed interest rate for a specified period of time. You can open one at almost any bank or credit union.                                     Are CDs safe?                                Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       CDs are safer than investing your money in the stock market. Money in a CD is federally insured by the FDIC or NCUA for up $250,000 for up to $250,000. CDs are a good place to store and grow money that you will need at a predetermined future date. While your money doesn't have the potential to earn as much as it would in the stock market, there is no risk. CDs may be less liquid than a savings account, though.                                     Are CDs a good investment?                                Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       Timing matters. CDs can be a good investment if interest rates are currently high and/or expected to fall. The biggest benefit of a CD is your ability to lock in a fixed interest rate. If interest rates fall during the term of your CD, the APY on your CD will not be affected. Conversely, if rates are expected to rise, then it may not be a good time to put money in a CD.                                     Can you lose money in CDs?                                Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       You cannot lose money in a CD if you leave it untouched for the full term length. It is like a locked savings account and the only way you can lose money is if you make an early withdrawal for which you are penalized.                                     Are CD rates going up?                                Chevron icon It indicates an expandable section or menu, or sometimes previous / next navigation options.       Yes, CD rates have been going up. Interest rates on CDs follow the federal funds rate, which is determined by the Federal Reserve. Thus far, the Federal Reserve has raised interest rates several times in 2023. Insider                                                        Here's what they had to say about CDs. (Some text may be lightly edited for clarity.)What makes a CD good or not good?Mykail James, MBA, certified financial education instructor,Â BoujieBudgets.com:"You always want to look at how much money you need to start up. And then if you can continuously add money in. Also, check not just what the interest rate is, but how often they pay out interest, whether it's monthly or quarterly."How should someone choose a CD term length?Roger Ma, certified financial planner withÂ lifelaidoutÂ®Â and author ofÂ "Work Your Money, Not Your Life":"I would think about when you need the money and then compare that with what the prevailing CD rates are, and then what makes sense from a financial perspective, but also from your own personal timing perspective."Mykail James, CFEI: "I believe in having a plan for whatever the funds are. If it's supposed to be a house fund, and you want to wait for another two years to buy a house, that's what you should be thinking of when you want to have this money."How should someone decide whether to put their money in a high-yield savings account, money market account, or CD?Tania Brown, certified financial planner atÂ SaverLife:"So I guess we'll start off with how much money you want to put in and the level of transactions you want to have. If you want to have any transactions, that automatically takes out CDs. Then you're stuck between the high-yield savings and the money market account."Sophia Acevedo, certified educator in personal finance, banking reporter,Â Personal Finance Insider:"Generally, I think a high-yield savings account or money market account could be good options for an emergency fund or short-term savings goals. A high-yield savings account offers a higher interest rate than traditional savings accounts at brick-and-mortar banks. Meanwhile, money market accounts might be worth considering if you want more account accessibility â€” several offer paper checks, ATM cards, or debit cards. CDs could be worthwhile if you don't need access to some of your money, since they have a fixed interest rate for a specific term."Methodology: How We Selected the Best CDsÂ Personal Finance Insider's mission is to help smart people make the best decisions with their money. author: Myles Udland
title: 3 takeaways from a busy week in markets: Morning Brief
description: What to know in markets on Saturday, February 11, 2023.
content:
This article first appeared in the Morning Brief. Get the Morning Brief sent directly to your inbox every Monday to Friday by 6:30 a.m. ET. Subscribe
Saturday, February 11, 2023
Today's newsletter â€¦ [+7701 chars]
content_full: This article first appeared in the Morning Brief. Get the Morning Brief sent directly to your inbox every Monday to Friday by 6:30 a.m. ET. SubscribeSaturday, February 11, 2023Today's newsletter is by Myles Udland, Head of News at Yahoo Finance. Follow him on Twitter @MylesUdland and on LinkedIn. Read this and more market news on the go with the Yahoo Finance App.Corporate earnings season is coming down the other side of the mountain after a hectic couple weeks.But even in the absence of a Fed meeting, or jobs report, or earrings reports from the marketâ€™s biggest companies, the past week offered plenty to investors on the biggest themes in markets and the corporate world that have featured so far in 2023.Fed bump fadesThis past week, the stock market saw the major indexes cap off their worst week of 2023.All three major indexes rallied to start 2023, with the Nasdaq enjoying its best January since 2001 after gaining more than 11% in the yearâ€™s first month.The early-year rally was punctuated on Wednesday, Feb. 1, when the Nasdaq gained some 2% after Fed Chair Jerome Powell said â€œdisinflationâ€ had become a feature of the U.S. economy in a press conference. In an interview with financier David Rubenstein this week, Powell reiterated his view that disinflationary pressures are reaching the U.S. economy â€“ primarily in the goods sector.The second time around, Powellâ€™s words didnâ€™t excite investors much.And as economic data shows the economy gained momentum in January, hopes for an imminent Fed pivot appear to be fading among some investors.Outside of any Fed-related influence on the marketâ€™s day-to-day action, the volatility we continue to see is not suggestive of a healthy market. Even with a rally to start the year that washed some of the stink of 2022â€™s losses for some investors.As strategists at Bespoke Investment Group wrote Friday in a note to clients, â€œVolatility is usually a characteristic of a weak stock market rather than a strong one.â€ And this yearâ€™s market has been notably volatile.Story continuesThrough the first 27 trading days of 2023 â€“ or the yearâ€™s trading through Thursday â€“ the Nasdaq has moved 1% in either direction 15 times, according to Bespokeâ€™s data. In the prior nine instances this volatility was seen, the market was down six times and the largest rally had been 7.2%, which pales in comparison to the ~12% gain seen in the index this year.Perhaps more troubling for the bulls right now are the other three years the Nasdaq saw this level of volatility through the first six weeks of the year â€“ 1999, 2000, and 2001. The heart of the tech bubble bursting.U.S. Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell responds to a question from David Rubenstein (not pictured) during an on-stage discussion at a meeting of The Economic Club of Washington, at the Renaissance Hotel in Washington, D.C., U.S, February 7, 2023. REUTERS/Amanda Andrade-RhoadesCuts continueIn the Corporate World, the dominant theme of the last few months has been the raft of companies announcing job cuts. This week was no exception.Cuts at Disney (DIS) were the headliner, with the company announcing Wednesday it would trim 7,000 jobs as newly returned CEO Bob Iger looks to cut $5.5 billion out of the business.In addition to these cuts, Iger also announced another restructuring of the companyâ€™s business lines, telling investors on the companyâ€™s earnings call these moves "will result in a more cost-effective coordinated and streamlined approach to our operations, and we are committed to running our businesses more efficiently, especially in a challenging economic environment."Alongside these cost cuts, Iger also said he would reinstate Disneyâ€™s dividend. His reward for this latest act of corporate wizardry? The end of a proxy fight with activist investor Nelson Peltz.And while job cuts have spread from the tech sector out into the worlds of media, conglomerates, and beyond, the tech sector remains the center of pressure for the white collar workforce right now.Zoom (ZM), one of the stock marketâ€™s first and biggest pandemic-related winners, announced this week it would cut 15% of its workforce, or around 1,300 workers. CEO Eric Yuan will also take a 98% reduction in base pay for this year while the balance of the companyâ€™s executive staff will see a 20% pay cut.Yuan said the companyâ€™s trajectory was â€œforever changedâ€ during the pandemic, but said Zoom â€œalso made mistakesâ€ as it staffed up to meet these challenges.â€œWe didnâ€™t take as much time as we should have to thoroughly analyze our teams or assess if we were growing sustainably, toward the highest priorities,â€ Yuan wrote in an email to employees. â€œ[The] uncertainty of the global economy, and its effect on our customers, means we need to take a hardâ€”yet importantâ€”look inward to reset ourselves so we can weather the economic environment, deliver for our customers and achieve Zoomâ€™s long-term vision.â€Dell (DELL), eBay (EBAY), and JPMorgan (JPM) were also among the major public companies that saw some level of staff reductions over the last week.SHANGHAI, CHINA - FEBRUARY 27, 2022 - (FILE) Customers shop at the first Disney flagship store in China in Shanghai, China, February 27, 2022. February 9, 2023 - Disney CEO Bob Iger says the company will cut 7,000 jobs to cut $5.5 billion in costs. That's about 3 percent of the global workforce. (CFOTO/Future Publishing via Getty Images)Crypto pressures riseAs markets rallied to start the year, crypto was front and center with bitcoin enjoying its best January performance since 2013, gaining nearly 40% in the yearâ€™s first month.But the early part of February has served as another reminder for the industry that crypto winter is here, even if the price for some blue chip crypto assets has firmed of late.BNPL giant Affirm â€“ which also announced a 19% cut to its staff â€“ said this week it would shutter its Affirm Crypto initiative. Like most companies cutting back, Affirm said in a shareholder letter due to economic uncertainty, â€œwe are doubling down on our core businesses.â€Evidently buying stuff now and paying for it later with crypto was not core to the business.Elsewhere in corporate crypto maneuvers, Robinhood said it would take a $12 million charge and had backed out of a deal to buy crypto company Ziglu, a deal initially announced back in April 2022.On the regulatory side, a busy year remained that way with the SEC announcing on Thursday a settlement with exchange Kraken over its staking business. As part of the settlement, Kraken agreed to pay a $30 million fine and shut down its crypto staking offering for U.S. users.Ahead of Thursdayâ€™s announcement, shares of Coinbase (COIN) fell 13% after CEO Brian Armstrong cryptically tweeted about talk of the SEC trying to shut down all staking for U.S. retail investors. The stock fell another 4% on Friday.Whether Armstrongâ€™s fears turn out to be founded or not, Thursdayâ€™s action from the SEC against Kraken was the agencyâ€™s fourth this year against crypto firms as the regulator continues to tighten its control of the industry.As SEC Chair Gensler told Yahoo Finance in December: "We are enforcing [existing securities laws]. We have publicly been saying to these crypto intermediariesâ€¦to come into compliance with the law.â€Gensler told Yahoo Finance he had one goal when it came to regulating crypto in 2023: make crypto exchanges and lending platforms come into compliance."They can do that appropriately, working with the SEC, or we can continue on a course with more enforcement actions, and I would have to say that the runway's getting shorter," he said.â€”Click here for the latest stock market news and in-depth analysis, including events that move stocksRead the latest financial and business news from Yahoo FinanceDownload the Yahoo Finance app for Apple or AndroidFollow Yahoo Finance on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Flipboard, LinkedIn, and YouTube

A recent report from China Daily noted that the country is about to launch a research center for blockchain innovation in Beijing. Chinaâ€™s National Blockchain Innovation Center will work with local universities, blockchain experts, and firms to explore core blockchain technologies.Â                      var rnd = window.rnd || Math.floor(Math.random() * 10e6); Currently, only 19% of the total filed applications have received approval.                     if (!window.AdButler) {                     (function () {                         var s = document.createElement('script');                         s.async = true;                         s.type = 'text/javascript';                         s.src = 'https://servedbyadbutler.com/app.js';                         var n = document.getElementsByTagName('script')[0];                         n.parentNode.insertBefore(s, n);                     })();                 }                                var AdButler = AdButler || {};                 AdButler.ads = AdButler.ads || [];                 var abkw = window.abkw || '';                 var plc575326 = window.plc575326 || 0;                 (function () {                     var divs = document.querySelectorAll(                         '.plc575326:not([id])'                     );                     var div = divs[divs.length - 1];                     div.id = 'placement_575326_' + plc575326;                     AdButler.ads.push({                         handler: function (opt) {                             AdButler.register(                                 172179,                                 575326,                                 [728, 90],                                 'placement_575326_' + opt.place,                                 opt                             );                         },                         opt: {                             place: plc575326++,                             keywords: abkw,                             domain: 'servedbyadbutler.com',                             click: 'CLICK_MACRO_PLACEHOLDER',                         },                     });                 })();                  Updates On Chinaâ€™s CBDC Development Blockchain technology and the CBDC project became the Chinese governmentâ€™s trademark. As for Chinaâ€™s CBDC development, the central bank has rolled out e-yuan (e-CNY), worth millions of dollars, across the country to promote CBDC adoption. According to aÂ report, the Chinese central bank launched about 200 activities for e-CNY across the country during the holiday period. These activities aimed to promote consumption. During this exercise, many cities in Chain rolled out 180 million yuan ($26.5) worth of CBDC in subsidies and consumption coupon programs. Global Times, a Chinese English-based news outlet, cited cities like Shenzhenâ€™s local government gave out more than $14.7 million worth of e-CNY to subsidize the catering industry. China has made several efforts, including setting targets for different cities to boost its CBDC usage. AnotherÂ report noted that Hangzhou city issued 80 yuan worth of e-CNY vouchers to each resident on January 16. The city gave away a total of 4 million yuan ($590,000) worth of e-CNY. Related Reading: Bitcoin SOPR Nears Vital Retest, Will Bulls Find Victory? Also, on February 1, senior ruling party officials in Suzhou City set a speculative key performance indicator for the end of 2023. The officials projected a 2 trillion yuan ($300 billion) worth of e-CNY transactions in the city by the end of 2023. Bitcoin plunges on the daily chart l BTCUSDT on Tradingview.com Their target is high for a single city, given the total e-CNY transactions barely exceeded 100 billion yuan ($14 billion) in October 2022, two years after the CBDC launch. The e-CNY wallet app featured a capability of sending red packets called hongbao for gifting money to attract new users. Earlier in January, the app also received an update to allow users to carry out wireless payments using Android phones. China has been a world-renowned technology hub over the years. With the new blockchain innovation research center, China could advance deeper and even become more successful. Featured Image from Pixabay l zhangliams and chart from Tradingview.com

author: Laurie Dunn
title: One last chance to turn the crypto tide?
description:
Bitcoin and the altcoins have taken a tumble. Will this continue, or are they about to bounce?
Bitcoin bounce?
Bitcoin fell from $24,300 down to $21,500 in around 9 days, which equates to an 11.5% fall in value. Many are calling for the cryptocurrency king toâ€¦
content:
Bitcoin and the altcoins have taken a tumble. Will this continue, or are they about to bounce?
Bitcoin bounce?
Bitcoin fell from $24,300 down to $21,500 in around 9 days, which equates to an 11.5% â€¦ [+2164 chars]
content_full: Bitcoin and the altcoins have taken a tumble. Will this continue, or are they about to bounce? Bitcoin bounce? Bitcoin fell from $24,300 down to $21,500 in around 9 days, which equates to an 11.5% fall in value. Many are calling for the cryptocurrency king to fall a lot further and even for it to come down and find new lows. When everyone starts planning for such a scenario we all know how that ends. The market will probably do the opposite. As it stands, bitcoin has fallen to the midpoint of the range between $25,225 and $17,600. Itâ€™s still too early to call, but a little bounce has already happened. A golden cross has just taken place on the daily for bitcoin and even though this is a lagging indicator, it is likely to be seen by the market as a promising sign. Looking at the short term, things also look quite good. The Stochastic RSI is an indicator that signals momentum, and this is at the bottom for practically all the short term time frames from 2-day, down to 4-hourly. A cross up has the potential to force price higher. Altcoins also A similar scenario can be seen with altcoins. Even though the total market cap of altcoins was forced back into the downward sloping channel, price has seen a bounce off of the 200-day moving average. It might be expected that the Total 3 at least moves back to retest the top of the channel, and with the daily Stochastic short term indicators also at the bottom, upwards movement could be forthcoming. Latest narrative Following on from the frenzied AI narrative that lasted quite some time, zero knowledge projects are the latest to run. Mina Protocol is one of the highest market caps in this category, and is riding high recently.Â  After a drop Mina has rebounded strongly and has recorded a 39% rise in only the last two days. Mina has arrived at the $1 resistance and a break through this could see it reach as high as the next resistance at $1.61. Dusk Network is another of the zk high-flyers. The privacy project put on 84% for a price of 26 cents on Friday alone. It did pull back to close the day on 18 cents, but has continued its rise today and has reached over 21 cents at time of going to press. 28 cents beckons. author: info@thehackernews.com (The Hacker News)
title: Enigma, Vector, and TgToxic: The New Threats to Cryptocurrency Users
description:
Suspected Russian threat actors have been targeting Eastern European users in the crypto industry with fake job opportunities as bait to install information-stealing malware on compromised hosts.
The attackers "use several highly obfuscated and under-developmâ€¦
content:
Suspected Russian threat actors have been targeting Eastern European users in the crypto industry with fake job opportunities as bait to install information-stealing malware on compromised hosts.
Thâ€¦ [+5925 chars]
content_full: Suspected Russian threat actors have been targeting Eastern European users in the crypto industry with fake job opportunities as bait to install information-stealing malware on compromised hosts. The attackers "use several highly obfuscated and under-development custom loaders in order to infect those involved in the cryptocurrency industry with Enigma stealer," Trend Micro researchers Aliakbar Zahravi and Peter Girnus said in a report this week. Enigma is said to be an altered version of Stealerium, an open source C#-based malware that acts as a stealer, clipper, and keylogger. The intricate infection journey starts with a rogue RAR archive file that's distributed via phishing or social media platforms. It contains two documents, one of which is a .TXT file that includes a set of sample interview questions related to cryptocurrency. The second file is a Microsoft Word document that, while serving as a decoy, is tasked with launching the first-stage Enigma loader, which, in turn, downloads and executes an obfuscated secondary-stage payload through Telegram. "To download the next stage payload, the malware first sends a request to the attacker-controlled Telegram channel [...] to obtain the file path," the researchers said. "This approach allows the attacker to continuously update and eliminates reliance on fixed file names." The second-stage downloader, which is executed with elevated privileges, is designed to disable Microsoft Defender and install a third-stage by deploying a legitimately signed kernel mode Intel driver that's vulnerable to CVE-2015-2291 in a technique called Bring Your Own Vulnerable Driver (BYOVD).  It's worth noting that the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation in the wild. The third-stage payload ultimately paves the way for downloading Enigma Stealer from an actor-controlled Telegram channel. The malware, like other stealers, comes with features to harvest sensitive information, record keystrokes, and capture screenshots, all of which is exfiltrated back by means of Telegram.  Bogus job offers are a tried-and-tested tactic employed by North Korea-backed Lazarus Group in its attacks targeting the crypto sector. The adoption of this modus operandi by Russian threat actors "demonstrates a persistent and lucrative attack vector." The findings come as Uptycs released details of an attack campaign that leverages the Stealerium malware to siphon personal data, including credentials for cryptocurrency wallets such as Armory, Atomic Wallet, Coinomi, Electrum, Exodus, Guarda, Jaxx Liberty, and Zcash, among others.  Joining Enigma Stealer and Stealerium in targeting cryptocurrency wallets is yet another malware dubbed Vector Stealer that also comes with capabilities to steal .RDP files, enabling the threat actors to carry out RDP hijacking for remote access, Cyble said in a technical write-up. Attack chains documented by the cybersecurity firms show that the malware families are delivered through Microsoft Office attachments containing malicious macros, suggesting that miscreants are still relying on the method despite Microsoft's attempts to close the loophole. A similar method has also been put to use to deploy a Monero crypto miner against the backdrop of a cryptojacking and phishing campaign aimed at Spanish users, according to Fortinet FortiGuard Labs.  The development is also the latest in a long list of attacks that are aimed at stealing victims' cryptocurrency assets across platforms. This comprises a "rapidly evolving" Android banking trojan referred to as TgToxic, which plunders credentials and funds from crypto wallets as well as bank and finance apps. The ongoing malware campaign, active since July 2022, is directed against mobile users in Taiwan, Thailand, and Indonesia. "When the victim downloads the fake app from the website given by the threat actor, or if victim tries to send a direct message to the threat actor through messaging apps such as WhatsApp or Viber, the cybercriminal deceives the user into registering, installing the malware, and enabling the permissions it needs," Trend Micro said. The rogue apps, besides abusing Android's accessibility services to carry out the unauthorized fund transfers, is also notable for taking advantage of legitimate automation frameworks like Easyclick and Auto.js to perform clicks and gestures, making it the second Android malware after PixPirate to incorporate such workflow IDEs.  But social engineering campaigns have also gone beyond social media phishing and smishing by setting up convincing landing pages that imitate popular crypto services with the goal of transferring Ethereum and NFTs from the hacked wallets. This, according to Recorded Future, is achieved by injecting a crypto drainer script into the phishing page which lures victims into connecting their wallets with lucrative offers to mint non-fungible tokens (NFTs). Such ready-made phishing pages are being sold on darknet forums as part of what's called a phishing-as-a-service (PhaaS) scheme, permitting other actors to rent out these packages and swiftly enact malicious operations at scale. "'Crypto drainers' are malicious scripts that function like e-skimmers and are deployed with phishing techniques to steal victims' crypto assets," the company said in a report published last week, describing the scams as effective and growing in popularity. "The use of legitimate services on crypto drainer phishing pages may increase the likelihood that the phishing page will pass an otherwise savvy user's 'scam litmus test.' Once crypto wallets have been compromised, no safeguards exist to prevent the illicit transfer of assets to attackers' wallets." The assaults come at a time when criminal groups have stolen a record-breaking $3.8 billion from crypto businesses in 2022, with much of the spike attributed to North Korean state-sponsored hacking crews.   Found this article interesting? Follow us on Twitter ï‚™ and LinkedIn to read more exclusive content we post.

author: CoinEdition
title: Tether Has Moved Reserves to Capital Union and Two Other Firms
description: Tether Has Moved Reserves to Capital Union and Two Other Firms
content:
• Tether has moved $37 billion of its reserves to Capital Union Bank in 2021.
  • The transfer of the share followed the companyâ€™s settlement with the New York Attorney Generalâ€™s office.
content_full: Tether Has Moved Reserves to Capital Union and Two Other Firms     Â       USDT/USD +0.02%      Add to/Remove from Watchlist          Add to Watchlist   Add Position     Position added successfully to:            Please name your holdings portfolio     Type:  BUY SELL    Date:           Â     Amount:    Price    Point Value:       Leverage:  1:1 1:10 1:25 1:50 1:100 1:200 1:400 1:500 1:1000    Commission:          Â   Create New Watchlist Create    Create a new holdings portfolio Add Create   + Add another position Close             Tether has moved $37 billion of its reserves to Capital Union Bank in 2021.The transfer of the share followed the companyâ€™s settlement with the New York Attorney Generalâ€™s office.The company has also ties with Ansbacher Limited and Cantor Fitzgerald.  According to the latest report, Tether Limited Inc., the leading cryptocurrency exchange that launched the asset-backed stablecoin Tether has moved a major share of its reserves to three financial institutions including Capital Union Bank, Ansbacher Limited, and Cantor Fitzgerald. Reportedly, the company hasnâ€™t yet revealed any details regarding its ties with the three institutions. The complete data on the distribution of the reserves of Tether or the accounts of the finances is still absurd. The companyâ€™s lawyer told that Tetherâ€™s financing details arenâ€™t transparent, stating that it â€œdoes not make public its banking relationshipsâ€. In addition, the lawyer has also told that the value or the composition of its reserve assets is also not made public. Notably, as per the internal records, in 2021, Tether transferred almost $37 billion of its reserves to the Capital Union Bank, an offshore,â€¦ The post Tether Has Moved Reserves to Capital Union and Two Other Firms appeared first on Coin Edition. See original on CoinEdition

title: Ethereum: Everything you need to know about Shapella mainnet upgrade
description: ETH accumulation is on the rise- The number of addresses holding 0.01+ coins increased. Demand from the derivatives market also saw an uptick.Â  Ethereum [ETH] recently revealed in a blog that the Shapella (Shanghai+Capella) mainnet upgrade was entering the fiâ€¦

• ETH accumulation is on the rise- The number of addresses holding 0.01+ coins increased.
  • Demand from the derivatives market also saw an uptick.Â 
Ethereum [ETH] recently revealâ€¦ [+3299 chars]
content_full: ETH accumulation is on the rise- The number of addresses holding 0.01+ coins increased. Demand from the derivatives market also saw an uptick.Â   Ethereum [ETH] recently revealed in a blog that the Shapella (Shanghai+Capella) mainnet upgrade was entering the final pre-launch phase after extensive testing and development.  The new upgrade will include several new features, the most notable of which will be withdrawals for stakeholders and the consensus layer.  Exiting validators will be eligible for full withdrawals, while active validators with balances over 32 ETH will be qualified for partial withdrawals.  As the hype around the Shapella upgrade rose, investorsâ€™ expectations of ETH also increased. ETH accumulation was on the rise as the number of addresses holding 0.01+ coins reached a 6-month high of 22,907,244.       Furthermore, demand for ETH in the futures market was also going uphill as ETHâ€™s open interest in perpetual futures contracts reached a 1-month high of $290,732,090 on Deribit.  Can this increased interest and accumulation be hinting toward a new bull run?  ğŸ“ˆ #Ethereum $ETH Number of Addresses Holding 0.01+ Coins just reached a 6-month high of 22,907,244 Previous 6-month high of 22,906,541 was observed on 10 February 2023 View metric:https://t.co/XXb0u19ouH pic.twitter.com/4bZlt6PMD1 â€” glassnode alerts (@glassnodealerts) February 11, 2023   Read Ethereumâ€™s [ETH] Price Prediction 2023-24  Marketâ€™s response ETHâ€™s price action has not been in investorsâ€™ favor lately, as its weekly chart registered a decline. As per CoinMarketCap, ETH was down by over 8% in the last seven days, and at the time of writing, it was trading at $1,519.80 with a market capitalization of more than $186 billion.  However, as we get closer to the launch of Shapella, the possibility of a bull run cannot be ruled out. Interestingly, Messari also revealed the same as Ethereumâ€™s moving averages materialized into golden crosses.Â   Has the Next Bull Cycle Begun for #Bitcoin and #Ethereum? +$BTC and $ETH moving averages materialized into golden crosses+Prep work begins in the UK for digital pound+@WisdomTreeFunds positions itself as a leading digital asset manager Full macro/crypto recap â¬‡ï¸ pic.twitter.com/bG9iQLbzfw â€” Messari (@MessariCrypto) February 10, 2023  Furthermore, ETHâ€™s daily chart revealed that the bulls had the upper hand in the market as the 20-day Exponential Moving Average (EMA) was above the 55-day EMA.  The Chaikin Money Flow (CMF), after registering a downtick, went up slightly towards the neutral mark, which was positive news. Ethereumâ€™s Money Flow Index (MFI) was resting near the neutral mark, suggesting that the market could head in any direction. However, ETHâ€™s MACD was concerning as it displayed a bearish crossover. Source: TradingView  Is your portfolio green? Check the Ethereum Profit Calculator  Can the metrics save ETH? Similar to Glassnodeâ€™s data, several of the other metrics aligned with investorsâ€™ interests as they looked in ETHâ€™s favor. For instance, ETHâ€™s exchange outflow spiked considerably, which can be considered a bullish sign.  Moreover, ETHâ€™s exchange reserve was decreasing, suggesting lower selling pressure. Apart from open interest, ETHâ€™s Binance funding rate also remained high, which reflected its demand in the derivatives market.  Thanks to the planned upgrade, ETHâ€™s development activity was up. Nonetheless, ETHâ€™s MVRV Ratio registered a decline, which can bring trouble in the days to come. Source: Santiment        Share                                     Share     Tweet
